story: She's the last one to ask for help but the first person to offer a hand. She's a proud young lady working two jobs to provide for her family. Tonight her mini van was broken into while at an elementary school. Let's restore her faith in humanity and give her a piece of holiday cheer!

story:
NC Dance Collective is a collaboration of unparalleled modern dance leaders who have merged organically as a platform to celebrate our talents. The show directors are Hilary Jordan and Sarah Molaro, both who hold extensive backgrounds in dance, performance and show creation. The larger collective consists of many long time dance teachers, choreographers and strong, experienced dancers who are excited to develop a deep and memorable event.

Our talents demand that we show ourselves to the community, that we let ourselves be seen as the artists that we are, and that we deliver our hearts through our passion to dance.

Healing through art begins and continues as we embrace our abilities and create new pathways for relaying our art. The choice to perform also supports the essential venues where art can safely unravel. To collaborate cohesively also models healing for delivering our best selves in a proud and honorable offering that gives us all an opportunity to embody our moving art more deeply and in a supported way.

This will be the fourth show: Dancing the Archetypes....and we are all so excited about it! The show will be May 19th, 2018 at 2pm and 7:30pm at Grass Valley's The Center for the Arts.

Our needs for this show are very simple, yet still require your help. Tickets will cover most of the show's $2000 in expenses, without much leftover to treat our performers.

Your donations will support our artists: DREAM COME TRUE FUNDS:

  • choreographer stipends
  • dancer stipends
  • producer and director stipends

 

Thank you for your generosity and support as we take another leap. With the bigger vision of evoking inspiration in our audiences we align with our truest expressions of our dance art. Your support allows our community to realize movement as both visual art and powerful therapy for artists and audience members. Your help ripples out to immeasurable pools of love, inspiration, and artistic prosperity, right here in Nevada County. Thank you for supporting your local movement artists.

Blessings and Reverence-

Sarah and Hilary and the Nevada County Dance Collective

story:
Jude Taylor has written book, music and lyrics for ‘Steep’, and this is his professional debut as a writer - following years of songwriting in his bedroom and delivering community arts projects as founder of ‘The Cognito People’ (working with partners including Curve, West Yorkshire Playhouse and YoungMinds). As a writer, Jude is keen to explore creating quirky, silly musical theatre that features honest and non-apologetic representation of LGBT+ people at the heart of its stories – especially when it comes to transgender characters. 

The idea for ‘Steep’ first came 5 years ago, and a few years later it ended up on paper for the first time. After 2 years of ‘proper’ writing and development, Jude pitched the show to The Other Palace in London in 2017, and has been incredibly grateful for the support, time and space we’ve received from them to continue to develop the work formally, mainly through private table readings in their Studio space. 

Why are we fundraising? 

The ‘Steep’ team and the incredibly generous actors who have participated in our previous table readings are so proud of this project and its progress, and we have put all our love into its development. However, musicals are very expensive endeavours and cannot live on love alone, and that is why we now need you! By donating to us you will be supporting the show and directly helping us to get all the resources we need together to be able to share ‘Steep’ with the world and to make these plans a reality. You’ll also have played a huge part (pun intended) in bringing a brand-new musical by a young LGBT+ writer to life, and supporting the wider new musical theatre scene/community here in the UK.  

When we say ‘support’, we don’t just mean financial donations, however – if you are not in a position to donate we completely understand, you can still make a HUGE difference by giving this crowdfunder a share, or sharing our updates on social media.  

Here are some examples of what your money will go towards: 

 - Paying our actors and creative team a proper wage for their work 

 - Rehearsal and performance space 

 - Physical resources, such as scripts and props 

By supporting this project, you directly become a part of not just the project, but the ‘Steep’ world itself, and we couldn’t be more grateful. In fact, we’ve got a few things to say thank you if you choose to support us.  

For a donation of £5 or more we will give you a personalised social media shout out from the Steep team. Get exclusive updates on the progress of Steep with a donation of £20 alongside your shout out across all of our online platforms. If you are generous enough to give us £40 or more, on top of the above, we will send you a personalised thank you letter o video (your choice!). For a very generous donation of £60 or more, in addition to all the above, you will receive an exclusive sneak peek at the current draft by receiving a page of the script annotated by Jude. Finally, if you are most generous enough to dedicate £100 or over to us, you’ll receive all of the above AND Jude will even write you a song based on a topic of your choosing (within reason, of course…)! 

Special Thanks  

We want to say a HUGE thank you to every single person who has been a part of the ‘Steep’ journey so far. We would not be at this point without your time, support and generosity, including: 

Amy Kemp, Simon Williamson, Nic Chiappetta, Sophie Rose Miller, Olivia Mann, Sam Peterson, Michael Robinson, Jordan Deegan-Fleet, Lauren May Crocker, Vic Cooper, Carolina Grierson, Kennedy Bloomer, George Strickland, Kiki Stevenson, Becci Snape and everyone at The Other Palace.

story:
Hello everyone,

Our team consists of eleven international Arts, Culture and Media students from the University of Groningen. As our final project, we came up with an idea for an immersive theatre production dealing with themes regarding immigration and the difficulties of being ‘the other’. You can get acquainted with us through our video above.

However, we are finishing our bachelor degrees and after various courses at Arts, Management, Analysis, Criticism and especially majoring in Theatre we want to use all of that knowledge to create something in practice. We are doing everything ourselves and we need your help to make it possible. We have distributed the different part of the organisation and creation among ourselves - acting, scenography, dramaturgy, directing, marketing and finances. But we aim high. The project we are working on would be held on a specific location where several different rooms would be constructed. Each scene of the performance would take place in a different room. How you get inside is something for you to figure out, but as a small hint: hold onto your ticket!

The special thing about it is the theme behind it - the feeling of “the other”. Everything began by our mutual frustration with the limitations a citizenship can impose on a person and especially - the visa procedures one has to go through to be allowed to enter another country. Every national passport gives access to certain places and the number and the countries themselves depend on your citizenship. Some nationalities have a wide variety of possibilities, while others are very restricted. But aside from this, there is another issue - the way you are being judged by the people you meet starts with your nationality. All the stereotypes and cliches, misinformation, lack of education about other countries - every immigrant has stories to tell about how differently they are sometimes being treated.

What we want to achieve is to raise awareness of this social issue. It is something experienced by thousands of people on everyday bases.

We need 500 euros that would be used for paying the rent of the chosen location, the props we need and to build up the separate rooms and for advertisement. One of the biggest expenses would be the elaborate video and sound equipment we need in order to create the immersive experience we promise.

The biggest threat we are facing is exactly the lack of sufficient financial resources, but we are doing our best to minimize our expenses - everything we use would be borrowed, rented or bought from a second- hand shops.

Any help including just spreading the word for our project would be highly appreciated. So please, share and tell people who might be interested in sponsoring us. Everything we collect would go into the performance even if we don’t reach our entire goal. In that case, we would look for alternative sources of financing.

We are here if you have any questions, ideas or anything you would like to share with us!

Thank you for giving us a chance to create something that reflects on issues that really matter to us!

story:
Chapter One: Once upon a time...

Hello we're Illustrated Productions, aka Ashleigh Dorrell and Katie McCann and we need your help!

We've decided to set up a brand spanking new theatre collective dedicated to creating theatre by melding good old fashioned storytelling with a darkly comic twist. Our first show, Tales from Briar Hall, will be staged at Theatre Upstairs this August 12th - 23rd in their wonderful, newly renovated space.

As a new company we are completely unfunded and that's where you come in! The development of this show depends entirely upon the love and support of you, the hard working public, to help us out in anyway you can.  Whether it is a €5 donation or a €50 donation, a like on Facebook or a share on Twitter we will be indebted to you. 

The money we are asking for is to go towards building our set, making our costumes and props as well as creating all of our beautiful promotional material. And believe us, this show would not be possible without your help.

Chapter Two: Our heroes assemble...

Below is a list of the wonderful people involved and also a bit of info on the show:

Director: Jeda deBri

Writer/Performer: Katie McCann

Lighting Design: Laura Honan

Set Design: Aoife Fealy

Consulting Designer: Simon Burke

Graphic Design/Performer: Ste Murray

Exec. Producer: Ashleigh Dorrell

About Tales from Briar Hall:

Illustrated Productions presents TALES FROM BRIAR HALL, a new play by Katie McCann. 

This is the story of two quite un-extraordinary people. If you were hoping for an extraordinary play about extraordinary people then I am afraid this is not the play for you.

Edward is not the type of boy that you would notice. Bullied his entire life, he retreats into the isolation of the woods beside his house, content to be left alone with the animals that inhabit it... but when he stumbles into the depths of Briar Hall one night, his presence is felt all too strongly by Daisy, the surreptitious inhabitant of the house. Daisy knows that this is destiny, that he is the one she has been waiting for and now that she has him, she has no intention of letting him go.

If walls could talk, you might not want to hear what Briar Hall has to say...

Illustrated Productions presents TALES FROM BRIAR HALL, written by Katie McCann, directed by Jeda de Brí, featuring Katie McCann as Daisy and Ste Murray as Edward. Illustrated Productions is a theatre collective dedicated to capturing the imagination of the audience using text and imagery. 

PREMIERES August 12th - 23rd @ Theatre Upstairs

    Chapter Three: The adventure begins...

    We wouldn't ask you to donate if we didn't truly believe that this was a project worth doing and even more importantly we want you to be a part of this adventure with us! Every donation will be hugely appreciated and we also want you to get a little something back for your generosity. By selecting some of the rewards we have to offer it is our way of saying thank you personally for your contribution to the cause.

    We are extremely excited about this project and we hope you are too!

      Thank you from Ashleigh and Katie x

story:
Hello! I'm Mark Kydd, an actor and writer, seeking support for my new one-man show, there were two brothers.

Having performed as an actor for more than two decades, I’ve told umpteen stories; invariably other people’s stories, using other people’s words. What really excites me about this project is that it’s my own story, told in my own words and drawn from my own life.

I began writing last year and an early version of the project was shared at that time. Subtitled 'storytelling, secrets and sibling rivalry', the play tells the story of my relationship with my older brother; it's told in tandem with a parallel tale of fictitious brothers and takes inspiration from memories of storytelling television shows of my childhood.

Although it's based on my own experiences and partly on my coming-out, I was thrilled to discover the play had a much broader appeal than I first imagined; it resonated with people from many different age groups and backgrounds, who identified strongly with the complexities, joys and frustrations of family life that are central to the piece. "I think that anyone could connect with the story, that was what was so clever about it. The story was essentially about anyone who feels disenfranchised " was a typical response. Inspired by this positive feedback, I felt encouraged to develop it into a fully-realised piece of theatre, with a new set and video design, which will be a integral part of the storytelling.


How you can help complete this story.

I’m looking to raise £2500. Of this, 20% will go towards the physical production (design etc) to be added to a pledge of £1000 provided by Glasgay! who are supporting the production (at the time of writing, our only source of funding). The rest of the money raised will go towards paying my wonderful team  - director Ros Sydney and video and sound designer Jamie Wardrop -  fantastically talented individuals who thus far have worked for nothing. They’ve shown great faith in the project and I would like this to be rewarded, even if we fail to reach our target goal.


What difference will your pledge make?

By pledging towards there were two brothers, you’ll be supporting a fresh, emerging voice in Scottish theatre and allowing new stories to be told at a time when many theatres are taking fewer risks with new repertoire. 

You will also be enabling a flexible, innovative production with great production values to tour throughout Scotland and beyond. This means that audiences living outside Edinburgh, Glasgow or Aberdeen will have opportunities to see the show - it’s our intention to create the piece in such a way that it can be performed in many different-sized venues and configurations, without compromising on its quality. Which means more chances for you to see and enjoy the show!


Convinced? Check out our perks, we had fun dreaming them up and think you will have fun getting them

We have some great perks on offer - in keeping with the theme of the piece, they’re story-related! They include having me come to your house to read a story of your choice, or, if you go for our top perk, we'll bring the entire show into your home! It's designed to be flexible, so we'll find the way to do it. Everyone who donates will have their name listed on a dedicated page on our website, unless you prefer to remain anonymous.


Note about perks - £100 Bedtime Story and £750 The Show in Your Home. We would love these perks to be "without borders" but feel sure you will understand that we must restrict these to Scotland only and will liaise with you about how and when they will be fulfilled. 


Risks & Challenges

Our main challenge is to raise this money in such a short period of time. Times are hard for theatre artists, but with your financial support, plus the sum provided by Glasgay!, we will able to make there were two brothers as we always imagined it.

If we fail to hit our target we must cut our cloth accordingly, which would mean a scaling-back of our ambitions. It would also mean talented artists working for nothing. But we are very confident that with your help, this won't happen.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help with all of this! Even if you can’t contribute financially, please help us create a buzz by spreading word about the show on Facebook and Twitter, and by using Indiegogo’s share tools. Or simply by talking about the show in the old-fashioned way.

Thanks for your time - here’s hoping there were two brothers has the happy ending it deserves!

story:
Why am I doing this?

Shortly before I graduated Meredith College this past May, I wrote and performed a staged reading of my one woman show Please Call Me Back at Meredith College's 2014 Celebrating student achievement day. Since then I have really wanted to find a way to perform and produce this show. And I guess that's where the problem is. Sure I could submit my play to theatre companies, but how would I sell myself, a novice twenty something actress as someone who could make money with this show? It's just ludicrous. And because it was ludicrous, I thought I should do the ludicrous thing and try to produce the show myself. 

What's it about?

It's about me, my cellphone and my family. When I was thinking about writing the play, I was trying to come up with a good narrative device to keep GIRL, me, there talking. I remembered a day in the courtyard behind the Meredith College chapel trying to call my mom. She wasn't able to get to the phone and I proceeded to leave her voicemails for about 2 hours. I could've stopped at any time. I even called my dad and he told me to call my uncle to pick me up. Did I do that? NO. I just kept calling the same number and though I part of me knew she wasn't going to pick up, I had to call for the faint chance that I might hear a "hello". I was trapped in this crazy passive aggressive cycle of inertia and years later in my playwriting professors office I thought "that's comedy". 

So that's how my play starts- with a string of passive aggressive voicemails. It then snowballs to communication on iphones, familial communication habits and eventually... the meaning of life. But more than that, at the end of the play, after the whole ordeal- I get a phone call. 

What's my gameplan?

I get it. You want to know what I'm going to do with your hard earned cash. I'm stingy, you're stingy. So here's my plan:

I am going to rent a space for one week. I will do tech and rehearsals in the space Monday-Wednesday and performances Thursday- Sunday. I know that I'm a new theatre artist and that it's a new play and that everything is just NEW. I want to do this project as a test to see if I can learn from the audiences I get and then move on to learn from my mistakes and try to produce again (so kickstarter this project may not be the last thing you hear from me on Please Call Me Back). I've been talking to some places and I want to spend about $3000 on the space. 

So what's the other $4000 going to you ask? Basically everything- hiring my crew, getting publicity photos, doing publicity for the show, and getting the show recorded if I can swing it. (By the way, If you see that I've made my goal, do not by any means be discouraged from contributing more. I'm going to need all the help I can get). 

And that's my gameplan. I want to try to get it produced at the beginning of next year or earlier if at all possible, we'll see though. 

In Conclusion

If any of this appeals to you by any means, make what contributions you can. Every bit helps and I will love you forever, especially if you end up coming to my show.
story_txt: Why am I doing this?Shortly before I graduated Meredith College this past May, I wrote and performed a staged reading of my one woman show Please Call Me Back at Meredith College's 2014 Celebrating student achievement day. Since then I have really wanted to find a way to perform and produce this show. And I guess that's where the problem is. Sure I could submit my play to theatre companies, but how would I sell myself, a novice twenty something actress as someone who could make money with this show? It's just ludicrous. And because it was ludicrous, I thought I should do the ludicrous thing and try to produce the show myself. What's it about?It's about me, my cellphone and my family. When I was thinking about writing the play, I was trying to come up with a good narrative device to keep GIRL, me, there talking. I remembered a day in the courtyard behind the Meredith College chapel trying to call my mom. She wasn't able to get to the phone and I proceeded to leave her voicemails for about 2 hours. I could've stopped at any time. I even called my dad and he told me to call my uncle to pick me up. Did I do that? NO. I just kept calling the same number and though I part of me knew she wasn't going to pick up, I had to call for the faint chance that I might hear a "hello". I was trapped in this crazy passive aggressive cycle of inertia and years later in my playwriting professors office I thought "that's comedy". So that's how my play starts- with a string of passive aggressive voicemails. It then snowballs to communication on iphones, familial communication habits and eventually... the meaning of life. But more than that, at the end of the play, after the whole ordeal- I get a phone call. What's my gameplan?I get it. You want to know what I'm going to do with your hard earned cash. I'm stingy, you're stingy. So here's my plan:I am going to rent a space for one week. I will do tech and rehearsals in the space Monday-Wednesday and performances Thursday- Sunday. I know that I'm a new theatre artist and that it's a new play and that everything is just NEW. I want to do this project as a test to see if I can learn from the audiences I get and then move on to learn from my mistakes and try to produce again (so kickstarter this project may not be the last thing you hear from me on Please Call Me Back). I've been talking to some places and I want to spend about $3000 on the space. So what's the other $4000 going to you ask? Basically everything- hiring my crew, getting publicity photos, doing publicity for the show, and getting the show recorded if I can swing it. (By the way, If you see that I've made my goal, do not by any means be discouraged from contributing more. I'm going to need all the help I can get). And that's my gameplan. I want to try to get it produced at the beginning of next year or earlier if at all possible, we'll see though. In ConclusionIf any of this appeals to you by any means, make what contributions you can. Every bit helps and I will love you forever, especially if you end up coming to my show.

story:
You know who's awesome? Tim Walker.  You know who else is awesome? Tim's awesome cat Jazzfart.

Jazzfart had an accident and now he needs our help.  And so does Tim.  Let's help the nicest guy and cat in the world get back on their feet, the way their loving, winning attitude helps everyone else get back on their feet when we've needed it.

Jazzfart needed some medical procedures, and pet stuff costs THE MOST so if you can help, please do! Anything helps and is the best.

So if you can, please help! If not, send some love to these fine folks.

Because they're kinda the best.

story:
Short Summary

 Burlesque Fitness has the dream of helping make collegiate burlesque accessible to college students who are interested in learning the art form of burlesque. We are a group that promotes both body positivity and burlesque learning and exploration. As a group we are always looking for new ways to learn and expose new members to the world of burlesque. We are looking to fundraise and go to the Great Boston Burlesque Expo. We were only partially funded by our college and are looking to raise the rest on our own. By going to this expo we can allow students a full exposure to classes, shows, seminars and workshops, as well as networking opportunities. We are fundraising money so that members can attend, we can travel to and from the expo, stay at the hotel, and feed ourselves. We are looking to bring approximately 8 people to the expo. With your help we can open the dialogue about what burlesque is and how it applies to Sarah Lawrence College students.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1,500 to make this a reality, if not we can not afford to transport and house ourselves, thus making us unable to go. 

By helping us out you will be helping support collegiate burlesque, What do you get in return? 

Well, Pledging $1 and up gets you a thank you note in our showcase program.

Pledging $10 gets you a custom piece of artwork

Pledging $20 gets you a pair of pasties

Pledging $50 or more gets you all of the above and a tee shirt.

 

The Impact

By helping collegiate burlesque you are giving the oppertunity to young people to take classes, seminars, network and see shows that are their first big exposure to what burlesque really is. We have been able to go in the past and it has resulted in the growth of the popularity in the art of burlesque. We also focus heavily on body positivity and the people who are going on this trip will be able to bring back more confidence and be able to teach and instuct others on how to build said confidence. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.

This cause means a lot to many students, especially those who would not normally be able to afford somthing of this nature. By donating you are giving the gift of education and confidence. We need people who believe in collegiate burlesque and our quest for a better burlesque education.

story:
Welcome!

The Seeing Place Theater has been honored with the performance rights to present a rare revival of the epic drama and Pulitzer Prize winner: MEN IN WHITE. This play opens our 5th Anniversary Season, and we're excited to engage our audiences in getting this play to the stage. 

Commonly referred to as the original “Grey’s Anatomy” as well as a pioneer in dramatic medical storytelling, Sidney Kingsley's racy and political play was The Group Theatre’s first critical success - and the first of its kind to take theatergoers into the heart of the operating room. 

We’re proud to be the first professional company in NYC to produce a full revival of the play in over 30 years, and one of only a few to tackle the play since The Group Theatre's landmark 1933 production. 

Why is this revival so rare? The play includes a large cast (16 actors playing 30+ roles) and requires enormous precision to depict hospital life in Depression-soaked New York City in 1933. This is why we're reaching our to you - our friends, families and colleagues - to help us tell this story the way it deserves to be told. 

More info about the show, running in NYC - November 8-24, 2013: MEN IN WHITE


What We Need (or How Can You Help?):

Your Support Makes All The Difference: After our last successful Indiegogo campaign in 2012, our production of DANNY AND THE DEEP BLUE SEA was extended Off Broadway and received a NYIT Award nomination. We could not have done that without supporters like you! 

We've already raised more than half of our budget for this play. We're asking for the remaining $5000 to help us obtain true-to-the-period costumes, set pieces and props ($2500+), as well as provide salaries for our talented cast and crew ($2500+.) Normally, theaters raise their ticket prices in order to cover costs but with our mission to provide low-price theater to audiences, we had to find another way.

So... raising these funds via Indiegogo will allow us to a) present this show the way it was meant to be seen, and b) subsidize our tickets so that more people can afford to attend live theater at a reasonable price. It also c) allows us to offer our "The Seeing Place: Unplugged" reading series, open to the public over 6 engaging evenings. 

With your help, we hope that MEN IN WHITE can make a similar impact, helping The Seeing Place stay a part of that small yet vital minority of financially solvent non-profit theater companies that produce relevant, well-written and compelling theater that reflects its dynamic community. 


Our Story (or who the heck we are!):

Now in its 5th Season, The Seeing Place is an actor-driven ensemble known for its intense and intimate work. Since 2009, we've been passionate about and forcefully committed to:

THE ACTOR'S PROCESS: Through robust table work and improvisation, we focus on honoring the actor's artistry in creating a character and building a story, which extends from rehearsal into performance. It's a pro-actor philosophy, and it's rare in today's market.

ORGANIC STORYTELLING: Unlike other companies, we do not set staging (blocking) or cement our choices in advance. Instead, what audiences get to see is a group of actors "in the moment" - working off one another to tell a fresh story that is never the same night to night. It's daring, it's exciting, and yes... a little bit dangerous!

COMMUNITY VALUE: Our mission is to make theater accessible for all New Yorkers by keeping ticket prices low and affordable - just $12 per ticket. We produce our shows in Hell's Kitchen in the heart of midtown Manhattan, a community hungry for strong, independent theater to combat the high priced, commercial offerings of Broadway. We've been awed by the positive response by critics & audiences about the unique, quality work we've been able to share at the independent theater level. 

But don't take our word for it:


What Critics Say About The Seeing Place: 

"In these recession strapped times, it's the best deal on or off Broadway."  
- Will Kenton, Cultural Capitol (CLOSER)

"I hope that The Seeing Place Theater continues to push the boundaries of theater in the off off Broadway community by producing thought-provoking, smart, and well-acted theatre. Oh, and tickets are only $12. You really can’t beat that.” 
- Zak Risinger, Theatre is Easy (LOVE SONG)

"How often does the opportunity arise to see one of the greatest American playwright's work produced by a company that takes their work as seriously as this one does, and delivers results that prove how effective that work is?" 
- Toby Ring Thelin, Theatre Knights (& Daze) (WAITING FOR LEFTY)

"This play can only be performed successfully with the type of chemistry that The Seeing Place demonstrates... This is the second production I have reviewed from The Seeing Place, and I haven’t seen a better indie theater value out there yet." 
- Chris McKittrick, Daily Actor (THREE SISTERS)

“If nothing else, you’ll be supporting a theater company with “for-the-people” principals. You’ll be supporting a theater company that deserves it." 
- Weston Clay, Theater is Easy (SCOTCH KISS)


Help Us Get The Word Out!:

One amazing way to help us reach our goal, and perhaps more, is by word of mouth support from people just like you. You can start by tweeting or sharing on Twitter and Facebook that you donated, along with a link back to this page. This will encourage your friends and followers to see what you're supporting. (If you like it, so will they!)

If you're in New York City (or Tri-State area), you can also help by spreading the word about our shows. We can't deliver great theater if we don't have an audience to deliver it to - please come out to the theater, and bring a friend! 

For more information about The Seeing Place or to buy tickets to our 5th Anniversary Season, please visit www.seeingplacetheater.com. To learn more about our philosophies and our impact in the community, visit our blog at theseeingplacetheater.blogspot.com.


Our Rockin' Ensemble Members:

Hillery Baker, Erin Cronican*, John D'Arcangelo, Stephen Dexter*, Chris Dieman, Jim DiMunno, Elle Emerson, Michael Gnat*, Mark Gorham*, Alexandra Hellquist, Justin Hoch, Logan Keeler, Jessica Kelly, Rose-Alma Lamoureux, Adam Levinthal*, Ivey Lowe, Nicole McLaughlin, Martine Moore, Brian Charles Rooney*, John Anthony Russo*, Frank Schiavone, Lila Smith*, Jamie Soltis, Stewart Steinberg*, Joe Tuttle*, Brandon Walker*, Maria Wolf.  

* - Member, Actor's Equity

story:
Who Are We?

The Waking Theatre is a group of Chicago-based theatre artists with specialities ranging from dance and music to technical design and visual art. This team will work together to stage and install Cymbeline in an unconventional warehouse space for an audience of emerging artists, urban explorers, and Shakespeare enthusiasts.

Our Cymbeline is a site-specific and immersive staging of the little-known feminist epic following two lovers' journeys from idealized love to its reality in an American fairytale landscape. Our designers are busy building the production's world drawing on an art form known to our audience for its archetypical characters, action/adventure plot lines, and sublime landscapes: the Western of twentieth century cinema. 

With the help of your contribution, The Waking Theatre will bring Cymbeline to life teaching us that, despite our human ineffectualities, love, wit and our common humanity will triumph over chaos.

What We Need and What You Get:

We are asking for a collaborative effort to raise $10,000. These funds go directly into the production and are crucial to making Cymbeline happen. 

We have a Production team of 10 people. Each of these individuals work collaboratively to promote the experience of the show and build it's community. We need funds to pay our collaborators, support our unconventional space, and reach our target audiences. 

The funds allocated to the Design team (5 people) are crucial for the environment of the production, and will serve to create and maintain a multi-sensory theatre experience. Our scenic, sound, and lighting designers will craft a transporting installation-like performance environment that will engage audience members' bodies, while our costume and prop designers will construct art objects, silhouettes, and textures evocative of our Western theme. 

The cast of Cymbeline is a group of 13 talented actors that will bring the timeless words of Shakespeare to the stage. Already in rehearsals, these actors are dedicated to the rhythm of the script and rigorous technique required by the Bard's poetry.

The Impact

With your help, we can make our dreams of Cymbeline a reality, and provide a truly unique theatrical experience that challenges the traditional paradigm, and infuses a classic text with an exciting contemporary sensibility.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We are asking you, our friends, family, and peers, to join our community and contribute in any way possible. A wide variety of materials and manpower will go into making Cymbeline a reality, and we would be thrilled to accept in kind donations in many forms. Please contact margoruter@gmail.com if you are interested in volunteering/assisting or would like to support the show in any way.

story:
The 1st Contemporary Circus showcase in Israel, 8th-10th December 2014.

My name is Orit Nevo, founder and artistic director of ON-Contemporary Circus Creation Center, I am active in Israeli and world Contemporary Circus since September 2000. I have been a performer for 25 years and a trapeze artiste and teacher for about 20 years. I Create and realize Contemporary Circus projects and collaborations worldwide, and I mostly write and direct circus shows for ON – Company. I have been consulting several festival directors in Israel about circus in the past 12 years, as well as the Council for culture and arts of the National lottery, foreign cultural attachés, Israeli cultural representatives abroad, and many theatre and circus groups and organizations in the country.  I have been a member of the jury and reading comity of various projects for new creation of contemporary circus, both in Israel and abroad. We thus have created a world network of cultural operators active and interested in the development of contemporary Israeli circus, which we hope to engage for this first exposure.

For the past 10 years ON - Company has gained a reputation Representing Israel in professional Contemporary Circus festivals and venues around the world, with its unique style and shows.

Circus for us is a living concept and a way of life, it is a way to search and express truth, it is our way of making a difference in the world and in the lives of people who we come in contact with.

video links: "InsideOut-ThisSideUp" , "Somewhere & Nowhere" , REVOLT #1

Now is the time for us to bring our creation home, 

It is our passion for the profession and our love of this country that has us want to present our work in Israel.

Revolt is our new project, (co-produced by the Pole Cirque Mediterranee, Marseille) 

It speaks about that moment in time when you feel you can't take it anymore, wanting to create something new for yourself or your community.

Revolt # 1 is a Live exhibition with the audience moving within the show itself.

Revolt # 2 is a frontal show created in the context of a Cinema that will host it's premiere in Marseille (the Alhambra). This show, on which we are currently working, is a brutal satire about human rights in the world today. It includes 6 circus artistes, acrobats, in the air and on the ground, a juggler, acting and texts in various languages live on stage and a huge cinema screen behind them. Cirque-Cinema, is the new genre we are working within, bringing the circus tent and circus arts into the cinematheque... The avant premiere of this will be presented in Israel on the 8th and 9th of December 2014.


We have been working on this campaign since coming back from our south American tour at the end of May, while at it, a war started all around us, human rights are constantly questioned in this conflict.  We hope that by the time this campaign ends, all fighting will stop and a dialogue will have started. Not putting the campaign out is not an option for us at this point, we really do need your help, now!  At the very least, we propose, that this campaign will promote culture and the arts of peace in Israel and it's support will be the expression of a will for a better, quiet and peaceful life in this region, for all who live here. 



Why is December 2014 so important?

December 2014 is an important and vital moment for the life of this project

and our work in general. We are embarking on a completely new idea and event.This is an opportunity for us to establish the foundation for our work and creation in this country. We therefore invite the Israeli business community and representatives of the cultural institution, to get involved and join us, to create together the possible future for this kind of work in Israel.

It will be a moment of exposure to artistic directors of festivals and venues from all over Israel, to see and experience our shows and discuss our way and vision, so that we can work together to bring these creations to audiences that otherwise would not have been able to see it.

It will be the first encounter between our International professional network of circus cultural operators and Israeli cultural operators for the sake of exposing Contemporary Circus as an art form, specifically Israeli contemporary Circus, to new audiences. A part for our own creation, Revolt # 2, that will be shown in avant-premiere, a program is being built with other guest creations and work in progress to be shown.

How can you help make this dream come true?

For the showcase to happen, we need 40,000$

The ON – company, is an international group of artists including French, Italian and Israeli performers. We need to work together both in Israel and in France between now and the showcase in Israel in December 2014. We plan to have 4 intensive rehearsal periods and we will use your contribution to pay for flights, rehearsal spaces, accommodation and payment to artists. 

Also our work has an important innovative and unique feature to it, as we use video and new media in various original ways since 4 years now. We will use the money also for filming, animation and editing costs.

And finally, the organization of the whole event, including a call for participants sent to a world and national network, their hosting in Israel, a VIP reception, a round table of professionals discussing the future of this art form in Israel and in the world, the rental of the theater and venue for all this to happen, technical light and sound equipment and operation, travel costs within Israel, Printed and digital materials prepared for the event and much more.

The ministry of foreign affairs has already confirmed their support for this event in hosting foreign festival directors. We are extremely grateful for this support.

It covers only a small part of the organizational costs.

We still need much more help!

What will you get?

On the right side of this page you will see a list of "perks" starting from tickets to the show, an eternal circus calendar, a poster, a CD with the music of the new creation, participation in the VIP reception and presentation, all the way to joining us to the world premiere in the International Biennale for Circus Arts (Provence, Alpes, Cote – d'azur), to be held in Marseille in January-February 2015.,

All you need to do is choose one (or more) you like most and sign up for it.

Another great way to help this project is to SHARE. Write an email to your friends; write about it on Facebook, in your blog or website.

Help the circle grow!

The Impact

This is an invitation for you to become a partner in our creation,

Join us in this way and get involved.

For the last year we have been working on this new creation REVOLT, mostly with our own funding, with lots of energy and enthusiasm to get us to this point.

Now, we are asking your help to reach the next milestone, December 2014!

Help us bring our work HOME!

Last but not least

We want to thank you for taking the time to engage in our dream.

We are also grateful for this platform. It is an incredible and simple way to make dreams come true. It connects us. Allows you to become a partner in making our work available to everyone, all over Israel, as well as around the world. We hope that when you see the REVOLT show – you will know this is possible, thanks to your help too.
story_txt:
The 1st Contemporary Circus
showcase in
Israel, 8th-10th December 2014.
My name is Orit Nevo, founder and
artistic director of ON-Contemporary Circus Creation Center, I am active in Israeli and world
Contemporary Circus since September 2000. I have been a performer for 25 years
and a trapeze artiste and teacher for about 20 years. I Create and realize Contemporary
Circus projects and collaborations worldwide, and I mostly write and direct
circus shows for ON – Company. I have been consulting several festival
directors in Israel about circus in the past 12 years, as well as the
Council for culture and arts of the National lottery, foreign cultural
attachés, Israeli cultural representatives abroad, and many theatre and circus
groups and organizations in the country.  I have been a member of the jury
and reading comity of various projects for new creation of contemporary circus,
both in Israel and abroad. We thus have created a world network of cultural
operators active and interested in the development of contemporary Israeli
circus, which we hope to engage for this first exposure.
For the past 10 years ON - Company
has gained a reputation Representing Israel in professional Contemporary Circus
festivals and venues around the world, with its unique style and shows.Circus for us is a living concept
and a way of life, it is a way to search and express truth, it is our way of
making a difference in the world and in the lives of people who we come in
contact with.video links: "InsideOut-ThisSideUp" , "Somewhere & Nowhere" , REVOLT #1
Now is the time
for us to bring our creation home, 
It is our passion for the profession
and our love of this country that has us want to present our work in Israel.
Revolt is our new project,
(co-produced by the Pole Cirque Mediterranee, Marseille) 
It speaks about that moment in time
when you feel you can't take it anymore, wanting to create something new for
yourself or your community.
Revolt # 1 is a Live exhibition with
the audience moving within the show itself.
Revolt # 2 is a frontal show created
in the context of a Cinema that will host it's premiere in Marseille (the
Alhambra). This show, on which we are currently working, is a brutal satire
about human rights in the world today. It includes 6 circus artistes, acrobats,
in the air and on the ground, a juggler, acting and texts in various languages
live on stage and a huge cinema screen behind them. Cirque-Cinema, is the new
genre we are working within, bringing the circus tent and circus arts into the
cinematheque... The avant premiere of this will be presented in Israel on the
8th and 9th of December 2014.We have been working on this
campaign since coming back from our south American tour at the end of May,
while at it, a war started all around us, human rights are constantly
questioned in this conflict.  We hope that by the time this campaign ends,
all fighting will stop and a dialogue will have started. Not putting the
campaign out is not an option for us at this point, we really do need your help, now!
 At the very least, we propose, that this campaign will promote culture
and the arts of peace in Israel and it's support will be the expression of a
will for a better, quiet and peaceful life in this region, for all
who live here. 
Why is December 2014 so important?
December 2014 is an important and
vital moment for the life of this project
and our work in general. We are
embarking on a completely new idea and event.This is an opportunity for us to
establish the foundation for our work and creation in this country. We
therefore invite the Israeli business community and representatives of the
cultural institution, to get involved and join us, to create together the possible
future for this kind of work in Israel.
It will be a moment of exposure to
artistic directors of festivals and venues from all over Israel, to see and
experience our shows and discuss our way and vision, so that we can work
together to bring these creations to audiences that otherwise would not have
been able to see it.
It will be the first encounter
between our International professional network of circus cultural operators and
Israeli cultural operators for the sake of exposing Contemporary Circus as an
art form, specifically Israeli contemporary Circus, to new audiences. A part
for our own creation, Revolt # 2, that will be shown in avant-premiere, a program is being built with other
guest creations and work in progress to be shown.
How can you help make this
dream come true?
For the showcase to happen, we need
40,000$The ON – company, is an
international group of artists including French, Italian and Israeli
performers. We need to work together both in Israel and in France between now
and the showcase in Israel in December 2014. We plan to have 4 intensive
rehearsal periods and we will use your contribution to pay for flights,
rehearsal spaces, accommodation and payment to artists. 
Also our work has an important
innovative and unique feature to it, as we use video and new media in various
original ways since 4 years now. We will use the money also for filming,
animation and editing costs.
And finally, the organization of the
whole event, including a call for participants sent to a world and national
network, their hosting in Israel, a VIP reception, a round table of
professionals discussing the future of this art form in Israel and in the
world, the rental of the theater and venue for all this to happen, technical
light and sound equipment and operation, travel costs within Israel, Printed
and digital materials prepared for the event and much more.
The ministry of foreign affairs has
already confirmed their support for this event in hosting foreign festival
directors. We are extremely grateful for this support.
It covers only a small part of the
organizational costs.
We still need much more help!
What will you get?
On the right side of this page you
will see a list of "perks" starting from tickets to the show, an
eternal circus calendar, a poster, a CD with the music of the new creation,
participation in the VIP reception and presentation, all the way to joining us
to the world premiere in the International Biennale for Circus Arts (Provence,
Alpes, Cote – d'azur), to be held in Marseille in January-February 2015.,
All you need to do is choose one (or
more) you like most and sign up for it.
Another great way to help this
project is to SHARE. Write an email to your friends; write about it on
Facebook, in your blog or website.
Help the circle grow!
The Impact
This is an invitation for you to
become a partner in our creation,
Join us in this way and get
involved.
For the last year we have been
working on this new creation REVOLT, mostly with our own funding, with lots of
energy and enthusiasm to get us to this point.
Now, we are asking your help to
reach the next milestone, December 2014!
Help us bring our work HOME!
Last but not least
We want to thank you for taking the
time to engage in our dream.
We are also grateful for this
platform. It is an incredible and simple way to make dreams come true. It
connects us. Allows you to become a partner in making our work available to
everyone, all over Israel, as well as around the world. We hope that when you
see the REVOLT show – you will know this is possible, thanks to your help too.

story:
With your funding, we can start trials for NSAIDs and insulin. Imagine diabetics who may no longer need injections. There are many drugs that can go through the lungs, instead of going through the digestive system or being delivered by hypodermic needles.

TheV-Meds.com

My name is Isaac Banoun, and this is my story.  My early years provided me with an international background, street smarts and an ability to think on my feet that made me uniquely suited to be the entrepreneur I would become.  I was born in Cairo and barely escaped with my family at the age of five, during the Suez Crisis and the Sinai war.  Our refugee boat made it to France, and, with no resources, my family made our way to Geneva and lived there until I was eleven years old.  Emigrating to the states, we settled in Brooklyn, where I attended New Utrecht High School and LIU, once I had adjusted to the culture shock.

Ready to make my fortune and fluent in English and French, I moved to Montreal, Canada, when I was 21 and worked hard to learn about the corporate world.  At first a salesman for the ad specialty industry, I connected with a holocaust survivor named Elly Gotz, who owned a company called Weldo Plastics; Elly gave me a job selling custom binders for the next seven years.  Cold calling on large companies lining the Trans-Canada Highway helped fill out my business education.  I always had an outgoing personality and a gift for gab that served me well in sales, and I eventually saw an opportunity in the packaging industry that led me to California.

I moved to LA and, with a $25,000 investment from my mother (pretty much all she had), founded California Box, a packaging company that distributed jewelry boxes in 48 hours, a niche that no one else was handling, and turned it into a 10 million dollar business.  The boxes were manufactured in Montreal and warehoused in LA, where I created a sales organization and continued to learn about the business world.  Having developed a niche in jewelry packaging, I was one of the first American businessmen to go to China to source manufacturers for my jewel boxes and my next business: Jewelpak, a company that eventually had sales in the neighborhood of 30 million dollars.  I lived in Asia for a while and speak some Chinese in addition to being fluent in English, French, Italian and Arabic.  Wanting to create a soft, touchy-feely surface for my jewel boxes led me to the invention of a coating with a soft feel, called Soft Touch. This product was unlike anything in the marketplace, and it led to a relationship with PPG in 1997 (the largest paint company in the world) to market Soft Touch globally. This started a partnership that would generate over a billion dollars in sales.

From packaging to coatings to paints, I then launched a relationship with Microsoft, who began using Soft Touch coatings on their Intellimouse Explorer.  Alsa Refinish was the business born from that.  Microsoft manufactured the Intellimouse in Guadelajara, where I cultivated a partnership with an injection molding company that eventually led to manufacturing injection molded loose-leaf binders for Avery Dennison.  Alsa Refinish, first a coating manufacturing company, currently specializes in automotive paint and textures, chrome paint, vinyl car wrap films, metallics and exotic finishes.

Every step of the way, I applied for patents and started businesses from just a thought in my head.  I have a history of making things happen, step by step, from invention to manufacturing to marketing to worldwide sales.  Aside from Soft Touch and many of the paints we produce today, I invented Allgun, which was the world’s first gun cleaning kit to clean all size guns.  I also patented a Glow Stick marker and sprayer, which combines Glow Stick technology and can be dispensed by spray or felt tip pen.  Surprisingly enough, I am not even in the gun or toy business.  For me, as the inventor and founder, V-Meds is the crowning glory of my long and varied career.  Pure serendipity led me from wanting to stop smoking to a vaping store to an idea in my head that screamed to get out into the marketplace.  And once again, I started a business from that one idea, what I hope will be my legacy.

TheV-Meds.com

Imagine a world where everyone can breathe free, using a revolutionary drug delivery system that produces molecules in their gaseous state as nano-droplets that can reach deep into the lungs to the alveoli, where the drugs can interact with the membrane as well as deliver them directly into the bloodstream. Other routes available for the system are sublingual, buccal and vaginal. The sublingual and buccal routes are especially important for delivering CNS drugs, including tranquilizers, analgesics and migraine drugs, to the brain.


The very device used by smokers to vaporize nicotine as a substitute for tobacco is ironically being used to deliver useful natural ingredients to clear smokers of the cancerous tar and other harmful tobacco by-products that have ravaged their lungs for years. This is our Lung Cleansing Treatment. This therapy can be used by asthma sufferers, patients with emphysema, bronchitis, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and other lung diseases, cough and cold sufferers, patients with inflamed sinus disease. City dwellers coping with heavily polluted air can use our system, which will mobilize the pollutants and expel them from the lungs with the phlegm and fluids that are secreted; this is due to the expectorant effect of the drugs in the formulation.

The difference between the conventional powder inhalers and Nano-Mist is in the size of the particles delivered to the lungs. The powder delivered by inhalers is in the micron range, and those micron drug particles are deposited in the upper part of the lung, where very few get to the alveoli.  The Nano-Mist droplets are in the nanometer range and will reach the smallest areas of the lungs.

The Nano-Mist delivery system can be used to deliver several types of drugs for aromatherapy, including nutraceuticals, herbal products, vitamins prescription and non-prescription (OTC) for migraine, headache, pain, arthritis, nausea and vomiting in cancer patients. The Nano-Mist Delivery System can be used to deliver any drug or therapeutic agent that can be converted into a gaseous state for delivery.

TheV-Meds.com

If you could help others, or maybe even yourself, breathe more freely and do this without the need for prescription drugs and their serious side effects, would you? If your answer is yes, then please join us in helping to make our product a reality and bring it to the world

    Our Product


    Every Kit Includes:
    1 Nano Mister with USB charger & wall plug, three 10ml bottles of Lung Cleansing solution in 3 strengths, an extra coil & a mixing bottle with needle filling cap, all in a leather case.

    Scientist and Doctor Formulated

    The active ingredients used in the lung Cleansing Treatment are all natural  and are classified as GRAS (generally recognized as safe) by the regulatory agencies. In addition they are pure and USP grade.

    Perks

    Everyone that donates in any category will receive a personal thank you letter from the founder and CEO of V-Meds and your name will be listed in a special webpage devoted to IndieGoGo contributors on our website.


    Give a gift of breath



    Give two gifts of breath

    * See our Perks Category

    TheV-Meds.com

    About our Funding

    We would like raise a minimum of $250,000.00. The funds will be used for R&D to develop other therapeutic formulas that include migraine relief, appetite suppressants, allergy relief, sleep enhancement, general pain relief, and erectile dysfunction.

    We will also use the funds for marketing, purchasing inventory, and patent reinforcement. If we do not reach our funding goal, we can still benefit from the money we raise. We have funded this entire operation, including the R&D, without any outside help. We will use what ever money we raise to further develop other therapies and improve our marketing.

      How this Technology will Impact the World

      The range and scope of this new technology will extend globally. All of humanity will benefit from our Lung Cleanser. We have 7 billion pairs of lungs on this planet that are breathing in air pollution, toxic chemicals, and tobacco. With the help of Nano Mist, there is no need for cortisone or steroids. Anyone can benefit  from this amazing product, both healthy people and individuals with lung conditions, such as COPD.

      We have (non-regulated) human studies and wonderful testimonials from individuals who have already benefited from our Lung Cleanser.  We understand that it may be difficult to believe some of our claims. After all, this product was born from an industry that promotes the use of nicotine. All we ask is that you please try our Lung Cleanser; we are certain you will be convinced about the therapeutic benefits.

        Our Challenges

        The one challenge we face is to separate ourselves from the e-cigarette industry. Our Lung Cleanser is at the opposite end of the spectrum. It is somewhat unfortunate that I discovered my idea while using a vaping device, but this does not take away from the benefits that can be derived from using our modified vaping system to deliver this world changing solution. Think of all the inventions and discoveries over the past 100 years that have been both beneficial and harmful. Probably the most famous is the atom. It can be used to generate atomic energy and provide electricity to millions of people, or it can be used to create weapons of mass destruction and kill millions of people.

        We really do not have many hurdles to overcome, because we are using the existing e-cigarette hardware for delivering medicine, as opposed to the industry that promotes using this hardware for cigarette cessation or for pleasure.  Our product is strictly medicinal and homeopathic.

        We have a staff of medical doctors and PhD's who have assisted in the design of our custom hardware and are directly involved in the formulation of our Lung Cleansing Solution. Your safety is always our number one priority.

          Other Ways You Can Help

          Even if you cannot contribute, we still appreciate the time you took to view our campaign.  Please help us get the word out.  Tell your friends, your co-workers, your family, and especially tell anyone that you know with breathing or respiratory problems.  And be sure to use the IndieGoGo share tools.  With your help, we can put an end to breathing problems and the invasive use of hypodermic needles.

          Thank you so very much,
          Isaac Banoun

          TheV-Meds.com

story:
Since 2004, Theatre@First has provided quality theatre at affordable prices.  With your support we've staged more than thirty mainstage shows, from one-acts to Shakespeare in the park!  We've created new programs and established a fun and thriving community. Now we need your help to keep our ticket prices low and carry our growing tradition of Somerville community theatre into its second decade. 

  As an all-volunteer, non-profit organization, we strive to keep our overhead low and channel the money we earn back into our shows.  The money you give today will pay for rehearsal space, costumes, lighting, performance venues, storage space, set materials, insurance, make-up and more. 

  Ten years ago we put a hand-painted sign on the sidewalk and complete strangers walked in to audition for our first show--and they keep coming!  Over the past decade more than five hundred people have taken part in Theatre@First and hundreds more have attended our shows.  We average just over half new cast members in each production, but at the same time we've built a strong community of regular participants, drawn together by our joy in creating theatre together for our wider community. We've celebrated weddings and births together and supported each other through unexpected tragedy and inevitable change. We occupy an important niche in the thriving Somerville arts community and we use our reach to support other community organizations including the AIDS Action Committee, The Somerville Commission for Women, and The Center for Teen Empowerment.  By donating to Theatre@First today, you will be supporting live theatre in your community and ensuring that we can continue to produce exciting and entertaining shows into the next decade. 

  Can't contribute?  We understand.  Help spread the word, by getting the word out! Link to us on your facebook, twitter, tumblr, livejournal, or your preferred media outlet.
  Come celebrate our 10th Anniversary and the success of this campaign with an evening of outstanding variety!  Theatre@First presents SomerVaudeVille at Johnny D's Uptown onWednesday, May 14th.  For tickets and more information, visit our website at http://theatreatfirst.org

We occupy an important niche in the thriving Somerville arts community and we use our reach to support other community organizations including the AIDS Action Committee, The Somerville Commission for Women, and The Center for Teen Empowerment.  By donating to Theatre@First today, you will be supporting live theatre in your community and ensuring that we can continue to produce exciting and entertaining shows into the next decade. 
  Can't contribute?  We understand.  Help spread the word, by getting the word out! Link to us on your facebook, twitter, tumblr, livejournal, or your preferred media outlet.

  Come celebrate our 10th Anniversary and the success of this campaign with an evening of outstanding variety!  Theatre@First presents SomerVaudeVille at Johnny D's Uptown onWednesday, May 14th.  For tickets and more information, visit our website at http://theatreatfirst.org

story:
Anchors Away!

Sea Legs is an award-winning original musical about four young orphans who long for adventure outside their quaint harbor town. But when adulthood, romance, and a few unexpected visitors are thrown in their path, they find that adventure might be closer than they once thought.  This coming-of-age tale will reconnect adults with their imagination and inspire children to find their own adventure.  

Don’t miss the boat - join us Off-Broadway in September 2014!

Where YOU Come In...

We need your help to create a fully realized production. To strengthen our production value and take this show to a professional level, your generous donations will be put toward the world that Sea Legs creates -- enhancing our scenery, costumes, lighting design, props and sound. 

In addition to design elements, your help will enable us to market the show to the best of our ability, to compensate our company for their invaluable contributions, and to work in spaces suitable for the development of our new musical.

When you contribute to our fundraising campaign, you'll be eligible to receive a variety of perks ranging from a shout-out on social media to a dinner with the creative team, showing how much your donation means to us. 

The Impact

Two best friends turned writing partners dreamed big to imagine what would become this nautical new musical. The student-run production at the University of Michigan exceeded expectations and challenged us to mount an Off-Broadway production in New York City, and it has been the adventure of a lifetime! Along the way, Sea Legs made quite a splash. The University of Michigan production touched all those involved, including our surrounding community. We cannot wait to expand the production's reach to a New York audience.

As emerging artists, we are so grateful to be given the opportunity to produce an original new work on an Off-Broadway stage. We'll be able to learn, grow, experiment, and evolve because of this experience, none of which would have been possible without you.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Spread the word! We need all hands on deck to raise our goal of $12,000. Sharing our Indiegogo campaign will help us extend our reach and make our dreams a reality. Join us on our adventure!

story:
ICARUS Contemporary Dance Company is in its fourth year as a student-run contemporary-based dance company at the University of California, Los Angeles.  In this 2013-2014 year, they have grown as a company, and are extremely excited to announce their third annual performance 'Sol'. It will exhibit a culmination of work from their own company members and from other guest choreographers. Sol reflects the exuberance and passion for dance that ICARUS members possess. 

Sol will be taking place on May 4th, 2014, at 5pm in UCLA's Schoenberg Hall. There are no admission fees, and Sol is open to any and all who want to attend this celebration of dance.

ICARUS Contemporary Dance Company is known for its technical abilities and for creating pieces that are both artistic and entertaining.  Their first ever annual Sol performance in May 2012 filled the Schoenberg Hall auditorium at UCLA.  We look forward to once again filling up the auditorium this year! 

We have been extremely thankful for the opportunities that have arisen for ICARUS this year, such as performing at UCLA's famous 26-hour dance marathon that raises money and awareness for pediatric AIDS.  ICARUS has also performed at various talent shows on campus and has several performances in the line up such as Bruin Day and UCLA Women's and Men's Basketball Halftime shows.

ICARUS Contemporary Dance Company is currently expanding its realms and working to create a name for itself throughout Southern California. We need the help from others such as YOU to help support us in our endeavors as a fledgling, student-run company!  As "starving students" at UCLA, ICARUS members need help fundraising for aspects of Sol such as costuming, flyers, programs, and venue.

By assisting ICARUS in reaching its goal of $1000, you would be helping facilitate the growth of contemporary dance as an art form in Los Angeles, and specifically be nurturing the dance community at UCLA.  

Even if you cannot donate today, we would really appreciate if you could spread the word of our campaign.  ICARUS Contemporary Dance Company would like to thank you for your time and effort in helping us share our passion and excitement for dance with our community.

story:
What is Stories That My Body Told Me?

Hello, my name is Snjezana Pruginic and I am from the former Yugoslavia. I immigrated to Canada 2 months before the 10 decade civil war started in the region in 1990. Leaving on the last plane on the then Yugoslavian airline  I remember feeling very proud of my identity and culture. As the war started and its effect began to be felt all around me, the Yugoslavian diaspora in Canada began to take on a very diverse form, challenging me and my own identity, as a new Canadian, a former Yugoslavian and a new something else...whatever the land that I called home was turning into. After the war, my country was split into 6 countries each one now with it's own identity, and across the ocean I was forced to the same.

“Stories That My Body Told Me” is  a multidisciplinary dance piece which explores the theme of identity transformation as a result of immigration, diaspora and war. The dance piece is based on personal stories by people former Yugoslavia.

As someone from former Yugoslavia I have been personally touched by the process of transforming my identity within the shifting definition of home. The multiculturalism of the Canadian social fabric and the rich culture of arts and dance permitted me to enrich my own sense of self and expand my own identity while ultimately creating healing and peace. Through creating this dance piece I want to engage with the diverse Canadian public and through dance and arts create a dialogue about the role multiculturalism, immigration and Diaspora play in shifting and enriching our personal and collective identities

Through a fusion of Contemporary and African dance this piece will explore the emotions and traumas that get locked in the body when one goes through an identity transformation due to immigration, war and diaspora.  Working across diverse cultural experiences the dancers will through the common language of dance and through the story of Stories That My Body Told Me create a space of unity which exists within the collective stories of the multicultural diaspora of Canada. The fusion of two distinct dance styles will highlight the intricate nature of the story while showcasing dance not only as an art form but a tool for personal and collective transformation and healing. 

About this campaign..

Right now Stories That My Body Told Me only exists on paper. This campaign is to fund a 3 week creation workshop from June 28 - July 11, 2014 where a group of 5 dancers, video artist, visual artist and sound artist will bring the story and the dance piece to life and bring it to the stage.  At the end of the three weeks the piece will be shared in a private, invitation only Work In Progress presentation with the hopes to publicly present the piece in 2015. 

This dream is being made possible through a wonderful and talented group of dancers and the highly acclaimed, award winning choreographer Olga Barrios

Artistic Direction and Story: Snjezana Pruginic 

Dancers: Olga Barrios, Roshanak Jaberi, Lilia Leon, Mateo Galindo Torres, Falciony Patino Cruz


Visual Artist: Carlos Delgado 


Choreographer: Olga Barrios


Where will your donations go?

This campaign will fund: 

  • Part of artistic fees of all dancers and artists involved 
  • Rental of studio and rehearsal space with Aluna Theatre
  • Cost of materials
  • Technical costs such as sound technician and stage manager
  • Cover the costs of shipping and producing any of the gifts offered in this campaign

Our thank you to you!!

Above everything you will get our profound and deep appreciation and thanks!! Your support is invaluable to making this a reality and we deeply thank you for it!

From tickets to the work in progress presentation to prints of original art used in the show, to a video about the journey of making this piece, to a copy of the written piece on which the show is based, to visiting us during the creation days, we want you to be part of this journey! Please see the full list of our "perks" and thank you gifts on the right hand side. 

All gifts will be included in Our Donors section of the program pamphlet on July 11th 

The Impact

A cultural revitalization in the diaspora of former Yugoslavia! An open and honest dialogue among all citizens of Canada and the role multiculturalism, immigration and diaspora play in shifting and enriching our personal and collective identities! A tribute to dance as a tool for healing! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with all of your friends! Help us spread the word and make this story a dance reality!! 

From the bottom of our hearts we thank you for your support!!!!

story:
What is TOOP?

The Opposite of People Theatre Company - colloquially known as TOOP - is a not-for-profit company on the University of Rochester campus which differs from other major arts organizations in one key aspect: it is composed entirely of students! Founded in early 2007, TOOP began as a small group of actors who wanted to produce their own theatre and has since grown to include not only actors and actresses, but also technical designers, directors, playwrights, and company management. This group of actors also felt strongly about providing educational opportunities not only for themselves as growing theatre professionals, but also for the campus they were born out of: thus, TOOP prides itself on offering free admission to all of its productions on the UR campus!

In addition to two original student works (one student-written and another student-translated), TOOP is also using this season to reach out to the Rochester theatre community with our production of The Importance of Being Earnest at this year's Niagara-Rochester Fringe Festival as well as a Holiday VIP Gala. With so many goings-on, we have decided to brand this season as our Lucky 13th Season and are hoping to raise $2,500 through Indiegogo to help us accomplish all of our goals!

What We Need & What You Get

TOOP produces at least two shows per regular season, typically operating out of the main room of Drama House on the Fraternity Quad of the UR campus. While Drama House has been fully outfitted for performance and is a great partner to TOOP, putting on a show takes a lot more than just a venue! Fees such as rights & royalties, production costs, and special events can often total up to several thousand dollars per season. Your money will go directly and only to TOOP activities, as all students work as volunteers nor do we contract anyone outside the group for assistance.

TOOP is known for producing high-quality, often minimalist plays. In addition to expanding into the greater Rochester community, it is our hope that this campaign will afford us the opportunity to take our productions to the next level technically. TOOP is full of talented designers who would love the opportunity to work with a full-sized budget.

As a thank you for donating, we have put together a series of gifts! Take a look to the right of your screen or below for more information on the cool TOOP stuff you can get your hands on!

Audience ($5 - $24)

  • Personalized shout-out on our Facebook page
  • Acknowledgement in all TOOP season playbills

Actor ($25 - $49)

  • AUDIENCE level perks
  • A ticket to our end-of-the-season Holiday VIP Gala

Designer ($50 - $149)

  • ACTOR level perks
  • One copy of each season poster signed by the cast and crew

Director ($150 - $399)

  • DESIGNER level perks
  • One TOOP fan shirt signed by all current company members

Producer ($400 or above)

  • DIRECTOR level perks
  • An evening and dinner with the TOOP Executive Board

    The Impact

    If successful, the funds raised from this campaign will go a long way towards both spreading TOOP's name in Rochester as well as increasing the groups capacity to "wow" audiences with brilliant spectacle. You will also have helped TOOP showcase some of the best talent that the University of Rochester has to offer, perhaps affording a student with the courage it takes to make the leap into professional theatre production.

    Part of the joy of being a TOOP is the exhilaration of participating in a group that is so consistently growing. The group's founders - now all graduated and finding their way in the world - couldn't have imagined what the group has grown into today. Similarly, TOOP's current members are sure to be just as surprised about where the group ends up in the next 13 seasons. It takes support from people like you, and a community like the one found at UR, though, to make the dreams of TOOP into reality.

     

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you are unable to contribute at this time, TOOP appreciates your support in any way that you find possible! Here are some other ways you can help out:

        • Like our page on Facebook and share information about our Lucky 13th Season campaign!
        • Come out and support TOOP by being an audience member of our 13th season shows! More information can be found on the TOOP Facebook page, or the TOOP website (both links are below).
        • If you own a business or know of a business that would be interested in supporting TOOP, please send a message to Kathryn Loveless, our Development Coordinator, and she will be in touch with more information.
        If you have any questions about TOOP, our 13th Season campaign, or anything else, please don't hesitate to contact us at the addresses below!

        Thank you for your time and support!
