story:
Mixed Revues and Quills

I love the theater, and do all I can to promote and improve it in and around Atlanta. I've acted in and directed everything from silly Ray Cooney farces to Shakespeare to contemporary and classic works like The Lady From Dubuque to A Streetcar Named Desire. But there are some shows that no community theaters and very few professionals will put on - either because their content pushes the envelope of local mores, or because they just don't have the box office draw. And yet many of these shows are important, and need to be performed. I started Mixed Revues as a way to bring these works to the Atlanta stage.

Doug Wirght's Quills is a perfect example of this type of work. Powerful, obscenity laden and blasphemous, it boasts full frontal nudity, bloody special effects and far beyond adult themes, But Quills is about more than simply the shock it can produce. It explores the boundaries between total artistic freedom and the responsibility an artist takes to his audience and society at large for the results of that expression. It exposes the tolls taken on the artist by the polar opposites of censureship and unfettered expression - tinted by love, religion, compassion and man's ultimate cruelty to his fellows.

Mixed Revues is the smallest possible theater company. It consists of myself as the Artistic Director, and whomever I can rope into each performance. Some of the company are repeats from previous shows, some new for each one. There is no board, no bylaws, no restrictions - also, no theater,no season subscribers, no sponsors and very little money. Pure artistic freedom always comes with a cost. No theatrical company can exist on ticket sales alone, and this is doubley true for groups that eschew the tried and true popular shows. And so, we reach out to you for help.

What We Need

We're hoping to crowd-source $5000 for this production, and as a seed for the next. Here's some of out actual anticipated expenses:


Theater Rental - 7 Stages Blackbox $3,000
Rehearsal Space $800
Royaltees and Scripts $650
Costumes and props $500
Sets and special effects $400
Marketing and printing $250

Subtotal: $5,600


We'll make up the shortfall with ticket sales, which will also go toward cast and crew stipends and a myriad of ongoing administrative and miscellaneous expenses. If there's anything left over, it will go toward the next production in the spring of 2014.


What We Give Back


In addition to our undying gratitude, Mixed Revues offers a number of perks for your generous donations. Most of these come in the form of acknowledgement and / or advertising on our web sites and in the program. We've also got half price tickets to any Mixed Revues show. Plus, signed copies of the paperback thriller "Chaos Theories" from Mixed Revue's artistic director Stephen Banks. But the most valuable thing we can give is the art you help us produce, and our pledge that it will be amazing.

story:
Who We Are

Nervous Theatre is a rootless theatrical collective dedicated to producing and touring new works and radically reimagined classics. The touring repertory company grew out of the Boston Conservatory where its founding members met. 

As a decidedly nomadic company we aim to create works that engage with a wide variety of communities. Nervous Theatre is committed to making accessible and affordable productions that exploit the liveness of theatre and embrace the unique relationship between audience and actor. We are interested in questioning theatrical forms, subverting audience expectations, and challenging conventional use of space and physicality.

We are excited to announce Nervous Theatre’s inaugural production, a West Coast tour of Jean Genet’s 1947 psychodrama, THE MAIDS. The production opens in San Diego at the Tenth Avenue Arts Center (January 10-12) followed by a weekend in Seattle at the Isaac Studio Theater (January 17-19). More stops will be announced soon!

As a young company, we are looking to you for help. Our debut production presents many expenses, of which only a small percentage will be covered by ticket sales. We're looking for gifts from supporters of the arts who welcome the opportunity to get in on the ground floor of an adventurous new theatre company. We hope you will consider supporting our campaign and partnering with us as we embark on Nervous Theatre's first theatrical venture.

-Connor Berkompas, Founding Artistic Director

 

What We Need 

Our goal is to raise at least $2,500 through INDIEGOGO.
Your gifts will help us cover the costs for the following:

$10 prints a night’s worth of PROGRAMS.
$30 covers one theater’s BOX OFFICE FEES.
$50 COSTUMES one of our actors.
$100 buys PROPS for our production.
$200 acquires all soft-good materials needed for our SET.
$500 pays the RENTAL FEES for a single performance.
$1,000 secures our ROYALTIES for the entire tour.  

Other Ways You Can Help

“I don’t have the means to give. How else can I help?”
We understand that not everyone is in a position to offer financial support. Help us spread the word about Nervous Theatre! Encourage friends and family to follow us on social media, attend our performances, and help spread the word about our INDIEGOGO campaign!

SHARE our INDIEGOGO Campaign link: https://igg.me/at/nervoustheatre

Facebook: facebook.com/nervoustheatreco

Instagram: @nervous.theatre

Website: nervoustheatre.com

About the Production

THE MAIDS is freely based on the true story of the Papin sisters, two live-in maids who killed their employer's wife and daughter. Jean Genet's 1947 psychodrama takes us deep into the "shadows where servants live.” Each night, sisters Claire and Solange perform a dangerous ceremony when their socialite employer is away. As they religiously enact the murder of their mistress, the line between fantasy and reality begins to blur.

This boldly intimate production explores Genet’s seductive world of role-playing where power, sexual identity, and desire are constantly in flux.

The production originated in Boston, MA at the Boston Conservatory in 2017. The original conservatory cast has reassembled for the West Coast tour. 

Connor Berkompas (Solange / Director)

Freelance director based in Southern California and Artistic Director of Nervous Theater. Recently directed Macbeth at American Coast Theatre Company and Sigh No More at Vanguard University.  BFA: Boston Conservatory

Sympathie the Clown (Claire)

A writer/performer from Brooklyn. Recently created the role of Nancy Reagan in Rat Queen Theatre Company's Judy Doomed Us All (Ice Factory). BFA: Boston Conservatory

Annabella Joy (Madame)

Actor, singer, dancer residing in Bozeman, MT. Has worked with various companies including Theatre by the Sea, in Matunick, RI and American Repertory Theatre in Boston, MA.  BFA: Boston Conservatory

story:
GRAYSCALE launches in New York City!

 

As my company begins it's next chapter as GRAYSCALE we have been invited to premier a new duet titled These Small Infinite Terrains on the East Coast as part of Erin Gottwald/e.g. dance  Out-of-Towners Guest Series in Downtown Brooklyn October 26th and 27th and on the West Coast in Santa Barbara November 9 and 10th.  This duet, with an original score by Los Angeles based Litronix, will be performed by Heidi Brewer and Tess Goodrich in NYC, and by Tess Goodrich and Megan Seagren in SB.  

 

Your Donation Covers

We need your help making these performances a reality!  All funds raised will go towards:

  • Artist Travel
  • Artist Compensation
  • Costume Design and Construction

This will be the first time we have performed in New York City since 2012 and we are thrilled to be once again generously presented by Erin Gottwald!! 

  • Through her series, Erin has provided out of town artists (many of whom where once NYC'ers) the opportunity to share these evenings together, cultivate connections in other cities across the US, and expose each other to dance happening nationwide.
  • Over the years I have enjoyed my connection to the dance community in Santa Barbara.  I feel strongly that it is a city that supports the artistic process and fostering that within smaller dance companies.  It is always a pleasure to present work there, and I am grateful in to be invited by my friend Tracy Kofford.  

 

Risks & Challenges

Your support at any amount will greatly assist our growth as a small dance company.  I fund my work solely out of pocket, and through your generous donations I will be able to take advantage of these opportunities extended to us; which will continue to create exposure for the work we make and grow our connections nationally. 

Less than 10% of the average U.S. arts non-profit's funding comes from federal, state, or local government support. The rest comes from ticket sales, private foundations, corporate sponsors, and individual donors (like you!) - Independent and/or emerging artists like myself may not have the visibility to generate high ticket sales or garner grants and partnerships. Therefore, individual donors are critical for our growth.

With your support, I will be able to bring my company and this work to new audiences and new cities - both of which will foster growth for myself as an artist and as for the company at large.


I am deeply grateful for the continued support I have received over the years and I thank you for believing in the arts and in my work.

-Jessica

story:
What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is to break even, so that all the profits from the ticket sales can go back to the artists and the creative team that helped make this show a reality.
  • Our perks include,show decications, personalised murder mystery letters and even a signed axe provided by Rage Montreal. 
  • Even if we do not reach out final goal, the funds raised will go towards rehearsal space, props and costumes, and venue fees. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If  you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Like us on Facebook @Project AlienCat
  • Come see the show! Tickets are available at https://montrealfringe.ca/organizer/slaying-in-...
story_txt:
What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to break even, so that all the profits from the ticket sales can go back to the artists and the creative team that helped make this show a reality.
Our perks include,show decications, personalised murder mystery letters and even a signed axe provided by Rage Montreal. 
Even if we do not reach out final goal, the funds raised will go towards rehearsal space, props and costumes, and venue fees. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help
If  you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

Like us on Facebook @Project AlienCat
Come see the show! Tickets are available at https://montrealfringe.ca/organizer/slaying-in-...

story:
Who We Are + What We Do

Dragon's Eye Theatre makes theatrical adventures for the children of Philadelphia and the adults who love them. Our work celebrates the wildness of children's imaginations and the child in everyone. We partner with Philadelphia community spaces that are not typically performance venues to offer frequent visitors a chance to discover new stories in spaces they already know and love by creating original, interactive plays inspired by those spaces, while also attracting new visitors.

We created our plays Seek & Hide and A Mystery? for Philadelphia treasure Smith Memorial Playground & Playhouse, finding all sorts of surprising stories within the toys and architecture that are beloved by so many families. Our most recent adventure, Follow Me Through the Gates, whisked audiences inside the action of the colorful Four Seasons mural that covers the walls of the Independence Branch of the Free Library of Philadelphia.

Now it’s time for us to start making something brand new! A new journey that gives kids and their adults a chance to move, think, giggle, build, and use their imaginations together. To see the world from different perspectives, playing with characters who look and talk like they do and characters who don't. To listen to new stories and to share their own.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need is simple: $500 to cover the costs of our October 6 Play Session.

What you get: your kiddo's newest favorite character in a Dragon's Eye play!

The gloriously unruly Trikings of Seek & Hide were invented in a Play Session. The story of the Old Woman who taught the Queen that "everyone serves everyone," became part of Follow Me Through the Gates in a Play Session.

Your support helps us dream up the next character who will inspire, challenge, and delight you, the kiddos in your life, and so many others.

 

The Impact

After every Dragon’s Eye performance, we spend time talking with our audience members of all ages. They can tell you all you need to know about how much they value our work:

Adults

  •  “It was very creative, very interactive. The children remembered every detail.”
  • “I loved that the story was multicultural. My kids could see themselves in it.”
  • "The play was about togetherness and the journey of our lives. I learned something too, not just the kids."
  • “This is great. There’s nobody else doing this.”

Kids

  • “It was awesome.”
  • “I liked everything!”
  • “I want to see the show again NOW!”

Your support makes it possible for us to bring Philadelphia’s kiddos and their adults a new dynamic, interactive, theatrical adventure made just for them.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to do something else to help Dragon's Eye Theatre? We've got you covered:

  • Leave us a message on our Facebook page or Twitter telling us why you love what we do. It really means a lot to us!
  • Have a neighborhood place you love to go that you think would be a great spot for a Dragon's Eye play? Tell us about it! Leave a photo of it on our Instagram.
  • Share this campaign with your friends. Indiegogo has share tools built-in to make it easy.

Let the adventure begin!

story:
Forty-years after the landmark Roe vs. Wade decision, ABORTION is still a dirty word.  You've seen a lot of talk about this in the news lately, but how many times have you heard the personal stories associated with this hot button issue?
 
That's what The A-is-for-Abortion Play is all about.
 
5 women, 15 characters, one dirty little secret. This political issue is about to get a personal voice, and it has a sick sense of humor. You know a woman who has had one—they just haven’t told you yet.
 
The play has it's WORLD PREMIERE at this year's New York International Fringe Festival.

PERFORMANCES: WED. 8/14 @ 2:00 pm; SAT., 8/17 @7:45pm; MON., 8/19 @ 6:45pm; WED., 8/21 @ 5:15pm; SUN., 8/25 @ 2:15pm

FringeNYC Venue #16: The Robert Moss Theater @ 440 Studios

And, we need your help!

We're raising $3,000 to help support the production of the show. What does it go to?  Well...

  • Costumes
  • Props
  • Actor Stipends
  • Creative team stipends
  • Marketing and PR

By helping us get this show off the ground, you'll be saying: 'No More!' No more of women not being able to express their right to have a say over their bodies and their heathcare.  And,  you'll also be saying 'Yes!' to female-driven works of theater.

Even if we don't raise all of the funds, every little bit contributed goes toward making this show a success.

You may also notice the goal is actually $3,270... this includes the fees associated with IndieGoGo and will ensure that we walk away with the $3,000 we need to produce the show.

About the Creative Team

Cassandra J Hume (playwright): Cassandra Hume is a Brooklyn-based playwright and actor. Her plays include: The Kitchen Spanish Tango, The 7 Sins of a Body-Hating Food-Lover, The EX-Cycle, A Grimm Reality (co-writer), IBID, and The A-is-for-Abortion-Play.  Her work has been produced at the Manhattan Theatre Source, and Manhattan Repertory as well as the Alchemical Theater Laboratory. Acting credits include: Edinburgh Fringe Festival, Nuyorican Poets Café, The PIT, Manhattan Theater Source, Broward Stage Door Theater, and the Annenberg Center. Cassandra graduated with a BA in Theatre Arts from the University of Pennsylvania.  She is a founder of In Search of a Song Productions, and the Generations Theater Project. www.cassandrahume.com

Joanna Bowzer (director): Joanna Bowzer is a New York City-based writer, director and producer with projects in film, theater and the Web.  She has advised or worked on the development and production of dozens of feature and short films, both in the U.S. and abroad.  Joanna recently directed, produced and co-wrote the feature film “Delusions of Guinevere” which is scheduled for release in Fall 2013.  Some of her other current film projects include “Under Her Skin” (producer), “Roses in Winter” (director, producer) and “Nice Guys Finish Last” (director, producer). Additionally, Joanna will be directing the world premiere of The A-Play at the 2013 New York International Fringe Festival. She recently joined the team at Dogfish Accelerator, an accelerator program for indie film producers. Follow her on Twitter: @joannabowzer.

About the Cast

Candace Bryant (Alexa)

Candace is excited to be making her FringeNYC Festival debut. Originally from Canada and a graduated of Mount Royal University, she worked as a actress, dancer and host before moving to New York to continue training in theater. Selected theatrical credits include: Marry, F*** or KIll (NY and LA), Chekhov’s Three Sisters (dir. Amy Wright), Dark Rapture, Come Back to the Five and Dime and Village of Idiots. Selected film credits: Subway Silk (which has recently been accepted at the New Filmmakers Festival), God is in the Yellow Pages, Amateurs (dir. Eric Tao) and The Inn (pre-production).
 

Eilis Cahill* (Dani)

Eilis has appeared in numerous regional plays and many short and independent films including Stakeland, Thicker than Water, and Nancy, Please. Her favorite roles include Emily in Our Town, Helen in The Cripple of Inishmaan and Heather in Doric Wilson's Street Theater. Eilis is a member of Actors Equity. This summer she will be seen in two FringeNYC productions: The A-is-for-Abortion Play and Baptized, by Kristen Lishen. 

Ellen David* (Eleanor)

Ellen David studied acting in London and graduated from William Smith College.  She lived and work in Israel where she appeared on Israel National television, toured with the English Theater of Tel Aviv, dubbed numerous films, and portrayed Pilate's Wife in the film Jesus Christ Superstar.  In New York, she was a founding member of the sketch comedy group "Rubber Feet", worked at the School House Theater, Working Man's Clothes, Fleetwood Stage, the Dramatic Question Theater, and appeared in various soap operas and Law & Order. She received the 2006 Innovative Theater Award for Outstanding Actress in a Lead Role.

Jen Harris (Bethany) 

Originally from Little Rock, Arkansas, Jen graduated from The University of Iowa with her M.F.A in Acting, and Clark Atlanta where she received her B.A. in Theatre. She has been a New York native for only one short year and is happy to be making her NY theatre debut in the New York International Fringe Festival with this awesome cast. Jen believes that all dreams come true if you're willing to work hard and make sacrifices. Speaking of dreams—"Have you ever seen a badger?"

Julissa Roman (Clarissa)

Julissa, originally from Perú, is a graduate of HB Studio and LAByrinth Theater Master Class. She has most recently performed at La MaMa Theatre in the play "Luz" (Luz) by playwright Catherine Filloux and directed by Jose Zayas Some other theater credits: “The Death of a Dream” (directed Obie Award winner Frank Perez);  “Crossings” (FringeNYC and Europe Theater Encounters);  “Girl Who Died Often” (Repertorio Español); “Build Your Own” (by Padraic Lillis). Film credits: “Nueva York” (Tribeca and NY Latino F.F.); “4 Latas” (San Diego F.F. and Human Rights F.F. Argentina). She is member of  “R.Evolución Latina”  organization that utilizes art to empower the Latino community, herself received a scholarship to study Shakespeare with Ian Hersey (Public Theater). www.julissaroman.com

Costume Design: Katherine Goerlich

Photos by: D. Robert Wolcheck

*Appearing Courtesy of Actors Equity Association.

Thanks for your support!

story:
Short Summary

We love to dance...and we love to create dancers.  If you can walk...you can dance!  Our mission is to enrich the lives of amputees and those with gait dysfunction by teaching them ballroom dancing.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to make our dream a reality!  We have costs that include: studio space, professional multi level instructors and dancers, transportation for the participants, monatary gifts for the volunteers and board members, simple but nice costumes, stage equiptment, music license, extra insurance coverage, advertising costs, photographer etc.....

The Impact

Could you imagine being held back from life...dreams...due to a  physical limitation?  We are not talking daily aches and pains.  We are talking about people that have lost limbs for whatever reason. Real life changing events!  For those of us that have abled bodies must reach deep in our being to even try to relate to this kind of situation.  As a life long dancers, a simple tweek of the ankle could be devasting to our careers.  We can only try to imagine life with the loss of a part of our bodies.  We want to be of help...but we need help to make this happen.  Please consider contributing to our cause!  You never know who the next dancing  star will be.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We can always use volunteers to keep it all together.  Paperwork is time consuming.  Non profit companies have an extraordinary amount of paperwork.  Perhaps you are crafty and could whip up a flyer.  Handy?  Our stage will need some work.  Techy?  We need videos,  photos and website help. Medically skilled?  Gosh, we would love some more medical input.  Please consider extending a helping hand.

story:
She Who Walks

Visit the Website if you'd still like to contribute to this campaign

"We were there at the very beginning before all things.  We were all there.  Everything that is was there.  Nothing has gone away"

She Who Walks is a project by Denise Rowe connecting Women, Land and Ancestry through performances, workshops and film.  It's about remembering the power that arises when we recognise our connection to the earth.

We are now in the third phase of the She Who Walks project.  The project began as a movement solo in 2012, became a large-scale site-specific promenade performance with 11 artists in 2013 and is now ready to become a short film and a performance that integrates film footage, dance, live music, spoken word, visual art and installation.

To bring this to life, we need your help.

We've been given some fantastic platforms in London and the South West of England through the projects exceptional partners, and are ready to take this powerful work out to reach wider audiences, to share the majesty of Devon's landscapes and awaken in all of us the power we have when we are connected to the land.

Here are our dates, follow the links to visit the websites:

23rd May: Immerse Residency, Dartington Space

31st May: 'Exposure', Spring Loaded, The Place, London

21st June:  Tagore Festival, Dartington

Autumn 2014 (date tbc):  Plymouth Univeristy

Denise Rowe is a movement artist, choreographer, musician, film-maker and creative producer who draws primarily on pan-African dance and non-stylized/environmental movement. Her work emerges from a creative movement practice on the landscape, an engagement with the is-ness of being alive in a physical form and an intimacy with body, earth and rhythm. 

Denise's work 'Opened a window into my soul' (Hassan Mahamdallie, Senior Strategy Officer, Arts Council England, after watching Denise Rowe's This Body, 2010)


What We Need & What You Get

We are in the process of an application for £12,000 (£3,000 confirmed and £9,000 fingers crossed!), added to this we need to raise £3,000 ourselves.  This will mean we can cover the costs of:

* Travel expenses and equity fees for the performers, film-maker, editor, lighting designer and artistic director during devising and performances

* Projector rental for the devising period

* Printed images for the installation

* Dvd production and replication

* Publicity

There is oodles of in-kind support already agreed including residency, studio space and marketing support from project partners ADAD, Arts at Dartington, Dance in Devon, Plymouth University and The Place, London

There are some great perks to thank you for your support, including personalised copies of the film, tickets to one of the shows, workshops, printed images and even the possibility of being in the film!  Have a look at the right hand side bar to see details of the offers.

If we don't reach our goal, the project will still go ahead as the artistic team are passionate and committed (hooray!)  But the artists won't be paid so well for their time, effort and expertise (boo!), and we'll be a bit more low key, less able to bring this valuable work into society - so lets help this happen!

If we reach more than our goal we can pay for some of Denise's time editing the film which she is currently offering unpaid


The Impact

"I am a nationally recognised dance and movement artist with 12 years experience choreographing, performing and facilitating workshops around the world.  My work is drawing together threads and walking into the unknown, allowing the creative process to unfold.  This project marks a bold step forward for me in my work; collaborating with an exciting new creative team, following creative passions, standing more clearly in my integrity and bringing this work to new audiences.

The project will:

*  Bring the power of the natural living environment into theatre settings

*  Awaken insight, creativity and imagination

*  Empower and transform our connection to the land

*  Support the empowerment of women

*  Forge a link between African dance aesthetics and environmental movement

*  Celebrate our natural landscapes!

This project marks the culmination of my ADAD (Association of Dance of the African Diaspora) Trailblazers Champions bursary.  The project partners are among the best in the country.  They support me to explore my practice, develop as an artist, support the development of emerging artists and grant this work fantastic exposure.

So far this project has only received limited funding, expenses have been covered but mostly the artists have not been paid.  With this opportunity to take the work to wider audiences with a higher profile comes the need to pay the artists for their work and resource the project financially. 

This supports the team of 5 artists involved in the performance project and the 11 artists involved in the film.

Art and artists play a vital and often unrecognised role in our society.  They transport us into the present moment, opening windows for reflection on our lives.  They take us to the heart of our humanity and bring us closer to our divinity.

"Great art and culture inspires us, brings us together and teaches us about ourselves and the world around us. In short, it makes life better" (Arts Council England)

The project recognises art as arising from the meeting between the artist and the earth. The artist's body becomes laboratory for the alchemy of that meeting and the creativity that arises is potently available to each of us.

Our awakened creativity helps us make transformative change in our own lives.

It's about remembering our place in the living cosmos, remembering our shared ancestry of women (and some men) who were persecuted for their empowered relationship with the land, and reclaiming the power that arises when we live our lives in connection with the land, at home on this magnificent Earth."

Denise Rowe, Director, She Who Walks


Other Ways You Can Help

•  Get the word out and tell your friends about the project.

•  Use the Indiegogo share tools!

•  Come to see one of the shows 

•  Come to a workshop

*  Like the Facebook Page

•  Visit the Website

*  Do you have a unique perk you could offer as a reward?  Or any questions or suggestions?  Get in touch via the comments page

Thankyou so much for your support!

we'll be a bit more low key, less able to bring this valuable work into society - so lets help this happen!If we reach more than our goal we can pay for some of Denise's time editing the film which she is currently offering unpaid
The Impact
"I am a nationally recognised
dance and movement artist with 12 years experience choreographing, performing
and facilitating workshops around the world.  My work is drawing together
threads and walking into the unknown, allowing the creative process to unfold.  This project marks a bold step forward for me in my work; collaborating with an exciting new creative team, following creative passions, standing more clearly in my integrity and bringing this work to new audiences.
The
project will:
*
 Bring the power of the natural living environment into theatre settings 
*
 Awaken insight, creativity and imagination
*
 Empower and transform our connection to the land*  Support the empowerment of women
*
 Forge a link between African dance aesthetics and environmental movement
*
 Celebrate our natural landscapes!
This
project marks the culmination of my ADAD (Association of Dance of the African
Diaspora) Trailblazers Champions bursary. 
The project partners are among the best in the country.  They
support me to explore my practice, develop as an artist, support the development of emerging artists and grant this work
fantastic exposure.
So far this project has only received limited funding, expenses have been covered but mostly the artists have not been
paid.  With this opportunity to take the work to wider audiences with a
higher profile comes the need to pay the artists for their work and resource the
project financially. 
This
supports the team of 5 artists involved in the performance project
and the 11 artists involved in the film.Art and artists play a vital and often unrecognised role in our society.  They transport us into the present moment, opening windows for reflection on our lives.  They take us to the heart of our humanity and bring us closer to our divinity."Great art and culture inspires us, brings us together and teaches us about ourselves and the world around us. In short, it makes life better" (Arts Council England)
The project recognises art as
arising from the meeting between the artist and the earth. The artist's body
becomes laboratory for the alchemy of that meeting and the creativity that
arises is potently available to each of us.
Our awakened creativity helps us
make transformative change in our own lives.
It's about remembering our place in the living cosmos, remembering our shared ancestry of women (and some men) who were
persecuted for their empowered relationship with the land, and reclaiming the
power that arises when we live our lives in connection with the land, at home
on this magnificent Earth."
Denise Rowe, Director, She Who Walks
Other Ways You
Can Help
•  Get the word out and tell your friends about the project.
•  Use the Indiegogo share tools!
•  Come to see one of the shows 
•  Come to a workshop*  Like the Facebook Page
•  Visit the Website*  Do you have a unique perk you could offer as a reward?  Or any questions or suggestions?  Get in touch via the comments page
Thankyou so much for your support!

story:
Hello! My name is Kat Ross and I’m the host of the podcast Shut Up! and Shimmy for now and hopefully for forever. I’m a belly dancer, producer, and mom whose committed to telling the stories from “behind the veil”. Though every dancer gets to tell a moment of their story in their bio before they dance, no one gets to know who they are as people. My goal is to take time to sit down with as many dancers as possible and let them tell us their stories. If I have contributors to this project I will be able to travel and reach out to dancers world wide. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to take this podcast on the road, I’ll need the proper equipment. 

2 Standing Mics: For better, more clear sound

3 Headphones: 2 for recording, 1 for editing

2 SD Cards: For mobile recording

2 Go Pros: For future video podcasts

1 Portable Mic: For on the go interviews

1 Sound Board/Mixer: To ensure well rounded sound

1 MacBook Air: For editing while traveling

Travel Expenses (Hotel, Gas, Food)

But guess what? YOU get perks for donating! Stickers, T-Shirts, and Advertising will be given out depending on your contribution level. You’ll be the first to receive official SUASPOD swag!

The Impact

This project is extremely important as it preserves history for dancers in the future. All of these audio recordings will be able to be looked back on and downloaded for free by anyone interested. We all watch videos of Samia Gamal and wonder more about her. Wouldn’t it be great to have a full hour long audio recording about her experiences? 

Risks & Challenges

This project will always have risks. Scheduling dancers, illness, and time conflicts. The podcast has actually already experienced these issues and we’ve learned to have a few podcast recorded ahead of time to prevent a week without a new podcast. 

Other Ways You Can Help

So, say you don’t have the cash to help out, that’s ok! Another way you can help is to share our podcast with your circles of friends and use the share features on the IndieGoGo page to get more eyes on our project!

story: .

SÚMATE A LA PRODUCCIÓN DE 

"HOY MI HABANA el que no tiene de Congo tiene de Carabalí". 

¡Un espectáculo musical estelar!.

Promociona tu negocio o tu marca o simplemente colabora!

Súmate a un proyecto  a corto y medio plazo!

ESTRENO

12 de Junio 2021  a las 21:00 horas de Canarias.

para su distribución en todas las islas a lo largo de los años  2021 y 2022.

 

¿Tenías ganas de viajar a Cuba y se te han complicado los planes? La  Habana la encontrarás en Fuerteventura  el 12 de Junio en el Palacio de Formación y Congresos

“HOY MI HABANA, el que no tiene de Congo tiene de Carabalí”. ¡Una experiencia autentica!

El espectáculo en vivo y presencial, será retransmitido en Streaming a través de una plataforma con presencia en muchos  países. Súmate al proyecto!

Tu aportación es muy valiosa, por pequeña que sea. 

 

Música, danza y humor dan vida a un espectáculo, evocativo, poético y explosivo.

Un gran abanico de intérpretes entre músicos, bailarines  y actores componen el reparto de

“HOY MI HABANA, el que no tiene de Congo tiene de Carabalí”, un espectáculo musical estelar!

PORQUÉ SUMARSE?¿

  • Quieres unirte a un proyecto cultural
  • Quieres promocionar tu marca y que tus clientes te reconozcan como una entidad  comprometida  con la cultura y la sociedad.
  • Quieres regalar a tus clientes una experiencia única e inolvidable.
  • Crees que la cultura es importante en la sociedad.
  • Quieres  comprometerte con  proyectos culturales porque te hace sentir bien. 
  • Quieres vivir experiencias emocionantes.
  • Eres apasionado de música, teatro y danza y quieres aportar tu grano de arena.

¡SÚMATE!  

Promocionamos tu marca dentro de nuestras publicaciones digitales e impresas. Podrás enviarnos tu video promocional que se proyectará antes del espectáculo y en Streaming.

 

El proyecto aspira a situar el espectáculo “ HOY MI HABANA, EL QUE NO TIENE DE CONGO TIENE DE CARABALÍ”, entre los proyectos culturales desarrollados en Canarias, que aporte valor adjunto a la oferta cultural, además de crear una red de colaboración entre la entidad productora y otras empresas locales y  de abrirse al mercado digital a través de las emisiones en Streaming.  

SINOPSIS

A partir de una frase del “poeta nacional de Cuba” Nicolás Guillén, la obra reflexiona sobre el mestizaje; como se fundamenta en las costumbres, se refleja en el habla y en la música.

 Un homenaje a la cultura cubana, con una puesta en escena multidisciplinar y contemporánea;   ambientación sonora y escenografía recrean la ciudad de la Habana, incorporando elementos orgánicos, gráficos, audiovisuales y de animación. Música, danza y humor dan vida a un espectáculo, evocativo, poético y explosivo. Un gran abanico de intérpretes entre músicos, bailarines  y actores componen el reparto de “HOY MI HABANA, el que no tiene de Congo tiene de Carabalí”, un espectáculo musical estelar!

LA PRODUCTORA

Amusic Sociedad Cooperativa Integral,  es una entidad comprometida con el desarrollo cultural y de las personas dedicadas a la cultura, actúa fomentando el trabajo artístico, facilitando y mejorando las condiciones de trabajo de las personas que se desempeñan en este ámbito. 

“..la integración laboral y profesional, la plena inserción socioeconómica, la auto realización y la defensa de personas o colectivos con especiales dificultades de integración o afectadas por cualquier clase de exclusión social o limitación de sus derechos sociales, o bien la satisfacción de necesidades sociales no atendidas, o atendidas insuficientemente por el mercado y las instituciones públicas,..” (Estatuto 2014-Amusic)

La actividad artística y cultural en España lleva décadas siendo definida por la precariedad, la temporalidad y la irregularidad en las condiciones laborales de quienes se dedican profesionalmente a ella.  

Uno de los objetivos de Amusic es la dignificación del trabajo artístico, ofreciendo a sus socios servicios de información,  gestión  y asesoría laboral.

La producción de HOY MI HABANA contempla la contratación de un amplio reparto de  artistas, técnicos y la colaboración con empresas privadas locales.

Operar hacia la reactivación del sector resulta imprescindible en estos momentos.

El espectáculo HOY MI HABANA, de gran despliegue artístico y  técnico, precisa de un proceso de producción e inversión inicial dirigida a cubrir gastos de creación de la obra, contratación de personal artístico y técnico, compra de materiales para la construcción de escenografía y vestuario, alquiler de atrezo y maquinaria,  producción audiovisual, viaje, alojamiento y manutención, transporte, publicidad y marketing. 

¿CÓMO FINANCIAMOS EL PROYECTO?

El proyecto, incluido en el Circuito de Artes Escénicas de Fuerteventura, cuenta con una ayuda a la producción por parte de la Consejería  de Cultura y Patrimonio Histórico del Cabildo de Fuerteventura y con financiación propia. 

Amusic es una sociedad sin fines de lucro. Los beneficios recaudados  en cada proyecto se reinvierten en proyectos culturales. La producción de " Hoy mi Habana" es  prueba de ello. 

 

SALA DE ESPERA

Utilizamos la expresión SALA DE ESPERA para definir un espacio audiovisual que se proyectará tanto en el teatro antes que dé comienzo la función presencial, cuanto en la presentación de Streaming.

El objetivo de la presentación es promocionar a los patrocinadores, a los colaboradores, a Fuerteventura como destino turístico y cultural. 

La apertura de la sala de espera será a las 20:15 horas en Canarias, el espectáculo dará comienzo a las 21:00 horas.

OTRAS FORMAS DE COLABORAR

Puede colaborar con la producción de Hoy Mi Habana en las siguientes  formas:

  • Ofreciendo tu disponibilidad como voluntario;
  • Comprando entrada presencial para ti y los tuyos;
  • Comprando y regalando entradas online;
  • Difundiendo el Proyecto en tus RRSS;
  • Compartiendo nuestras publicaciones en tus RRSS;
  • ¡INFORMATE! AMUSIC.ES

Short Summary

My name is Krista Leigh Pasini, and I'm the co-director of HaltForce Art Collective which produces performance based artist residencies and events in and around Billings, Montana. We often collaborate with Dave Schanno on performance and installation projects and we would like to elevate the value of how a strong lighting and sound design is part of, and in many cases - essential to, the artistic process. 

Our "Adopt an Artist" campaigns highlight artists working and living in Montana. This particular campaign directly highlights the work of those often behind the scenes. 

What We Need & What You Get

HaltForce's most recent performance project was a two weekend event helping host a BRAND NEW Billings dance company in a black box studio that required a full weekend install. We also hosted choreographer and artistic director Joy French of Bare Bait Dance.  Dave was inspired by the technical requirements of her evening length work, DANCE | words | DANCE and the software that managed it from a single platform.

Whatever is raised will go directly to Dave; the benefit is that we support an artist in his trade, elevate the opportunity for Dave to offer the performing arts community a dynamic tech design, and support the artists traveling to Billings who share their art with us. This is a community investment.

The Impact

The upgrades facilitate running complex shows without the need for multiple operators or highly skilled operators. They combine audio, lighting, and projection control into one work surface. They will also be used to train a new generation of theater technicians in the art of show production and education outreach, which will include: Nova theater, Senior High Theater, and  more to come. 

Risks & Challenges

Billings does not have a deep reserve of sound and light technicians for smaller venue performances and it's the same through out the state. Lighting and sound design is often a profession that isn't sustainable in Montana for many. It's time to invest in the professional upgrades to better accommodate this part of our art community in Billings. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would be grateful if you'd share this with your friends to get the word out to a wider audience.

And let us not forget the value of coming to the shows he's involved in! Thank you to everyone who attended What Stories Tell Stories and DANCE | words | DANCE the past two weekends as part of HaltForce Art Collective's performance residency. You can also follow Dave's work at Yellowstone Repertory Theater, Senior High Theater, and Nova Theater too.

story:
Travel to 1849 where, Monsieur Levesque, a charming young emigre, invites you to partake in a seance; are you a skeptic or a believer? What will you do to stop an aggressive spirit? While exploring a real 19th century mansion you will be relied upon to collect stories, clues and ultimately decide the fate of one young woman who is either gifted or tormented by the spirits around her. Every night is unique because every audience is unique.


Love to investigate? Look into our perks to see how you can join us, get a private tour of the house, get a private show with a real life mentalist or go spirit hunting for real with a professional paranormal researcher.

Show Dates: Fridays and Saturdays at 8pm October 5th through November 2nd

Location: The Cotting Smith Assembly House, Salem MA

SALEM, OCTOBER 1849

Indulge yourself in the early Victorian period with a night of secrets, spirits, seances and scandals. While you roam this historic house, uniquely converted by Samuel McIntire, you will get to know the intimate secrets of some of Salem’s most interesting and famous residents, how will you use your information to help some and harm others? There are infinite paths in a house of Smoke and Mirrors


Blackthorn Winter, Intramersive 2018, Photo Courtesy of Creative Collective

 

BUT WAIT, WHAT’S GAME THEATRE?

You may have heard of immersive theatre through shows like Sleep No More, And Then She Fell or experiences like Meow Wolf where the audience is inside the show, but what is Game Theatre you ask?

Game theatre is a step deeper into immersion. Intramersive developed game theatre back in 2017 when we took immersive theater and live action role playing and combined the two to create immersive, playable experiences where the audience has the same agency as the characters and the end of story is in your hands. You step into our world as a member of it, you do not need to invent a character, your personality is enough. Our characters bring you in as though you always belonged, entrust you with their secrets, and ask you for your unbiased opinions. When you participate in our world, your actions have consequences, your decisions mean something, the ending is up to you to make happen.

WHERE DOES ALL YOUR MONEY GO?

Meeting you halfway! We are already halfway funded thanks to the support of the Peabody Essex Museum. We have already covered artistic stipends, the cost of the venue and marketing. So what’s left you might ask? Well...

You get to come in at the fun part. If you love costumes, furniture, props, magic, tech crew, support staff, lighting, sound and special effects, then you are on the right team! 

The drawing room inside the Cotting Smith Assembly House, 2019

We are asking for $18,000 because, while we have the whole mansion to ourselves, it’s curated by a museum so we can’t really let you sit on the furniture, climb on the tables (as you do sometimes), go through the jewelry boxes (did no one teach you manners?!?). So it's been cleared out and we need you to help us fill it! We are going to get furniture you can lay down on, sit on, climb on, and riffle through. Not to mention some seriously creepy taxidermy (I mean it is the Victorian times) and some lifelike dead things under glass (fake dead things, well, fake mostly dead things...).

Additionally, and surprisingly to our returning Daemonologists, we also have access to electricity so we want to take full advantage of tricking out the lights, playing with sound and in general making the place feel as luscious and unsettling as possible. 

We are also excited to be able to work with local, talented artists who will help make some of these props and costumes. Funding this show helps fund the greater creative economy because we love to work with local shops, artists and vendors.  

Your funds will help make the world of Smoke and Mirrors one in which you can engage all five of your senses (or six, you do you).  

 

 

WHAT QUALIFIES YOU TO MAKE A WORLD?

Daemonologie: Smoke and Mirrors is the third installment of the Daemonologie Series produced by Intramersive Media, an immersive game theater company based in Salem MA. We create engaging shows that ask the audience to be involved and be as much as part of the story as they like. We have collaborated with numerous organizations as well as produced 5 original shows since our founding in 2017. Credited with creating “larp theatre” we aim to produce opportunities for audiences to become activists, heroes, villains and storytellers in a theatrical experience built to adapt to them. 

The team we have assembled to bring you this world is as impressive as they are creative. 

Carly Dwyer - Artistic Director, Co-Writer, Co-Director, is an award winning theatre director, larp writer and educator born and raised just north of Salem. Her Salem claim to fame is that she has worked all but one Halloween in Salem since 1995, the exception being the year she was on the road with Cirque du Soleil. 

Diana Dunlap - Lead Writer and Content Developer, Co-Writer, Co-Director, is a playwright, historian, museum educator and veteran first person interpreter. Diana is also one of the founders of the Salem Historical Society where she is still a board member.

Jasmine Kimieye Graham - Media Specialist and Art Director, is a visual artist, animator, educator and professional technomancer. Jasmine is also one of the creators at Marche des Goblins.

Caryn M. Boehm - Stage Manager, is a veteran theatre professional and Creative Engagement Producer at the Peabody Essex Museum. 

Evan Northrup - Director of Magic and Mentalism - is a professional magician, mentalist and performer born and raised just down the street from the Cotting Smith Assembly House.  

Kristin Harris - Dramaturg, Co-Writer, Go To Historian is a Salem based historian, educator, first person interpreter, paranormal researcher, and the creator behind the Life After Midnight podcast. Kristin is also a thanatologist, which isn’t the science of knowing everything about Thanos...well, actually, maybe it is.

Mike Schondeck - Creator of Digital Content - Mike Schondek is a video producer and experimental artist from Boston, MA. Mike also takes credit for the resurgence in the popularity of the song "Africa" by Toto. 

Jake Egan O'Hara and Breck Sullivan - Costume Designers - This award winning duo have been styling some of the regions most memorable productions such as Pippin with Actors Singers Project and My Fair Lady with Theatre III and Candide  with Opera Del West. 

Daemonologie: Oakham, Intramersive 2017, photo by Creative Collective

TREASURES FROM FAR AND WIDE

Our perks give access to custom made keepsakes designed and made by our Art Director, Jasmine Kimieye Graham. 

Discounted tickets to the show. 

VIP tickets to the show and unique show experiences. 

Tour the house with the creators and look backstage at how it all comes together.

PEM passes which give you free access to the rest of the Peabody Essex Museum! 

A chance to go ghost hunting in Salem with paranormal team member, Kristin Harris

A private magic and mentalism show with the exceptional Evan Northrup.

And other fun options!

WHEN AND WHERE

We are honored to be teaming up with the Peabody Essex Museum and the Creative Collective who are helping us continue to offer high quality immersive content for audiences looking for something special out of their trip to our magical city. 

Photo courtesy of the Peabody Essex Museum website.

Cotting-Smith Assembly House, 1782

138 Federal Street

Built as a Federalist Clubhouse in which balls, concerts, lectures, and other events might be held. George Washington attended a dance here. The original architect is unknown, but the house was later remodeled by Samuel McIntire for use as a private residence. The house is in the Federal style and is listed in the National Register of Historic Places.

"Mrs. Kelley" played by Jennifer Emerson, Smoke and Mirrors 2019, Photo by Joey Phoenix

SOUNDS RISKY

What if we don’t make our goal? Well, this is our first time crowdfunding and our first time with financial support. We’ve been operating solely off ticket sales and good choices since the beginning. We’ve put up 5 productions on our own without outside support. If we don’t make our goal we will be forced to price tickets in a way that will cover the gap, which we really don’t want to do. Even if we don’t reach our full goal every contribution helps. Every dollar we bring in from this campaign goes directly into the show. If you are able to make it to see the show you will be able to see the impact of your contribution. If you are unable to see the show you will still be able to follow along as we bring this show to life and see how your contribution helped create an experience so many people will enjoy. 

If we have survived this long without crowdfunding why now? Because while we have met our goals on our previous shows it’s never exactly for profit. We price tickets as fairly as we can while paying everyone involved but there isn’t usually much left over. Ticket revenue from this show will be used to produce more shows and launch new talented writers and designers. At every step of the way you are funding jobs and sustainability in the creative economy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t contribute but want to support the show? Thank you! Here are actually super helpful things you can do!

Share our campaign and let people know about our show!

Like us on Instagram and Facebook! Share and comment. We reward our loyal friends so you never know!

And that's all there is to it.

Not to mention some seriously creepy taxidermy (I mean it is the Victorian times) and some lifelike dead things under glass (fake dead things, well, fake mostly dead things...).
Additionally, and surprisingly to our returning Daemonologists, we also have access to electricity so we want to take full advantage of tricking out the lights, playing with sound and in general making the place feel as luscious and unsettling as possible. 
We are also excited to be able to work with local, talented artists who will help make some of these props and costumes. Funding this show helps fund the greater creative economy because we love to work with local shops, artists and vendors.  
Your funds will help make the world of Smoke and Mirrors one in which you can engage all five of your senses (or six, you do you).   
 
WHAT QUALIFIES YOU TO MAKE A WORLD?
Daemonologie: Smoke and Mirrors is the third installment of the Daemonologie Series produced by Intramersive Media, an immersive game theater company based in Salem MA. We create engaging shows that ask the audience to be involved and be as much as part of the story as they like. We have collaborated with numerous organizations as well as produced 5 original shows since our founding in 2017. Credited with creating “larp theatre” we aim to produce opportunities for audiences to become activists, heroes, villains and storytellers in a theatrical experience built to adapt to them. 
The team we have assembled to bring you this world is as impressive as they are creative. 
Carly Dwyer - Artistic Director, Co-Writer, Co-Director, is an award winning theatre director, larp writer and educator born and raised just north of Salem. Her Salem claim to fame is that she has worked all but one Halloween in Salem since 1995, the exception being the year she was on the road with Cirque du Soleil. 
Diana Dunlap - Lead Writer and Content Developer, Co-Writer, Co-Director, is a playwright, historian, museum educator and veteran first person interpreter. Diana is also one of the founders of the Salem Historical Society where she is still a board member.
Jasmine Kimieye Graham - Media Specialist and Art Director, is a visual artist, animator, educator and professional technomancer. Jasmine is also one of the creators at Marche des Goblins.
Caryn M. Boehm - Stage Manager, is a veteran theatre professional and Creative Engagement Producer at the Peabody Essex Museum. 
Evan Northrup - Director of Magic and Mentalism - is a professional magician, mentalist and performer born and raised just down the street from the Cotting Smith Assembly House.  Kristin Harris - Dramaturg, Co-Writer, Go To Historian is a Salem based historian, educator, first person interpreter, paranormal researcher, and the creator behind the Life After Midnight podcast. Kristin is also a thanatologist, which isn’t the science of knowing everything about Thanos...well, actually, maybe it is.
Mike Schondeck - Creator of Digital Content - Mike Schondek is a video producer and experimental artist from Boston, MA. Mike also takes credit for the resurgence in the popularity of the song "Africa" by Toto. Jake Egan O'Hara and Breck Sullivan - Costume Designers - This award winning duo have been styling some of the regions most memorable productions such as Pippin with Actors Singers Project and My Fair Lady with Theatre III and Candide  with Opera Del West. 

Daemonologie: Oakham, Intramersive 2017, photo by Creative Collective
TREASURES FROM FAR AND WIDE
Our perks give access to custom made keepsakes designed and made by our Art Director, Jasmine Kimieye Graham. 
Discounted tickets to the show. 
VIP tickets to the show and unique show experiences. 
Tour the house with the creators and look backstage at how it all comes together.
PEM passes which give you free access to the rest of the Peabody Essex Museum! 
A chance to go ghost hunting in Salem with paranormal team member, Kristin Harris
A private magic and mentalism show with the exceptional Evan Northrup.
And other fun options!
WHEN AND WHERE
We are honored to be teaming up with the Peabody Essex Museum and the Creative Collective who are helping us continue to offer high quality immersive content for audiences looking for something special out of their trip to our magical city. 

Photo courtesy of the Peabody Essex Museum website.
Cotting-Smith Assembly House, 1782
138 Federal Street
Built as a Federalist Clubhouse in which balls, concerts, lectures, and other events might be held. George Washington attended a dance here. The original architect is unknown, but the house was later remodeled by Samuel McIntire for use as a private residence. The house is in the Federal style and is listed in the National Register of Historic Places.

"Mrs. Kelley" played by Jennifer Emerson, Smoke and Mirrors 2019, Photo by Joey Phoenix
SOUNDS RISKY
What if we don’t make our goal? Well, this is our first time crowdfunding and our first time with financial support. We’ve been operating solely off ticket sales and good choices since the beginning. We’ve put up 5 productions on our own without outside support. If we don’t make our goal we will be forced to price tickets in a way that will cover the gap, which we really don’t want to do. Even if we don’t reach our full goal every contribution helps. Every dollar we bring in from this campaign goes directly into the show. If you are able to make it to see the show you will be able to see the impact of your contribution. If you are unable to see the show you will still be able to follow along as we bring this show to life and see how your contribution helped create an experience so many people will enjoy. If we have survived this long without crowdfunding why now? Because while we have met our goals on our previous shows it’s never exactly for profit. We price tickets as fairly as we can while paying everyone involved but there isn’t usually much left over. Ticket revenue from this show will be used to produce more shows and launch new talented writers and designers. At every step of the way you are funding jobs and sustainability in the creative economy. 
Other Ways You Can Help
Can’t contribute but want to support the show? Thank you! Here are actually super helpful things you can do!
Share our campaign and let people know about our show!
Like us on Instagram and Facebook! Share and comment. We reward our loyal friends so you never know!
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who are we?

We are two best friends who are passionate creating theatre together! Patrick Avery-Kenny is the writer and one-man-actor of this play, while Hailey is the director and technical designer. We have worked together as actor/director for 3 years, and Gamer Boy is our first self-written play AND Fringe show we have done. As two aspiring artists, this show has been a great contribution in both our theatre careers and by travelling with this show, we are hoping to gain more experience within this beautiful (and complicated) industry.

What is "Gamer Boy"?

Gamer Boy is a true story told by Patrick himself about an unbelievably trip he went on when he was 13 years old. Without giving TOO much of the story away, 13 year old Patrick took his video game a little bit too far when we travelled across North America, by himself, to compete in a live gaming tournament. We had an incredibly successful 6-show run at the London Fringe Festival last summer (2018) and now we are so excited to be doing the show again THIS summer in Windsor and Calgary! Which brings us to our next point...

We need your help!

While we consider this show, the story and the experience of creating and performing this play priceless, traveling with a Fringe show does come at a cost. After looking at the expenses required to make this tour happen, we wanted to make an Indigogo so those who support us, our show, or theatre in general can help fund this venture. Here is what the donations will be helping to fund:

  • Production Fees: theatre rental, tech rentals (ie. lighting equipment), billeting/lodging
    • Windsor - $450
    • Calgary - $700
  • Travel costs for Windsor - $150
  • 2 plane tickets for Calgary (round trip) - $1000
  • Marketing materials - $100

Any donation, no matter the amount, counts and is greatly appreciated! Check out our perks to see what items or shenanigans you can receive as appreciation for your support!

Thank you so much.

This show is honestly a dream for the both of us. We both feel so lucky to be sharing this play with more people this summer and are incredibly grateful for the support and love. We both thank you for reading and your potential donation! You're the best!

story:
ECC has decided to give the community another virtual show! We're doing a spin off of our classic Drunk24 Festival! On May 22nd at 7:30pm ET, we're inviting people around the country to participate in this online night of theater... or as we're calling it "Site"-Specific REBIRTH!

 

What does this mean?
Since our community is in quarantine, we're adapting one of our favorite community events and making weird art in strange spaces... your spaces! During our first round of this festival, we were able to collaborate with ECC community members from near and far under quarantine. With over 300 people watching on the night of the performance, we were able to reach an extraordinary amount of people during this time. We're so excited to do this again!


OH, and did we mention... "Site"-Specific 2020 is a DRINKING GAME!? That's right! Instead of watching the performers have all the fun, you'll get to join in too! Grab your beer, wine, tea, or juice and join in!

 

What We Need & What You Get

This event is donation based, which is why you're here! ECC is producing this festival to engage our community and to raise awareness about arts groups struggling during this time of need. Every dollar counts and will be going directly to artists affected by Covid-19.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If a monitary donation doesn't seem right for you right now, that's ok! Come join us on May 22nd at 7:30pm ET and join in on the fun! You can visit our website and register to watch "Site"-Specific REBIRTH now! www.exquisitecorpsecompany.com

story:
¿Qué es esto?

Esto es, querido amigo o amiga, una campaña de crowdfunding. Estamos, en estos tiempos inciertos, luchando por llevar el teatro y la cultura desde Canarias hacia el resto de la península. Por eso pedimos tu colaboración. A cambio, los mejores asientos para las funciones que elijas y contenidos exclusivos sólo para los mecenas. 


Quiénes somos

Teatro la República

La Compañía de Teatro La República nace en el año 1997 bajo la dirección de Nacho Cabrera con el deseo de proponer una visión diferente del trabajo teatral. 

Desde entonces ha acuñado éxitos lejos de las leyes de mercado y de visiones comerciales abordado a autores como William Shakespeare, Yolanda Pallín, Juan Mayorga, Borja Ortiz de Gondra, Suso de Toro.

La República es una compañía comprometida desde el noble arte del teatro con la realidad social y política de nuestro tiempo. 

Destacadas entre sus puestas “Ciudadano Yago” Versión de Otelo de Shakespeare,  (actualmente en cartel), “Hamelin” de Juan Mayorga, “Cuando las mujeres asaltaron los cielos” versión de Macbeth de Shakespeare, “NWC – No War Cabaret”de Nacho Cabrera “Dedos” de Borja Ortiz de Gondra, “Nano” deSuso del Toro, etc….

Sala Cuarta Pared

25 años de experiencia nos han permitido convertirnos con el tiempo en una sala diez:

  1. Somos un núcleo plural y dinamizador de las artes escénicas contemporáneas.
  2. Mantenemos un claro apoyo a las nuevas dramaturgias en nuestra programación.
  3. Somos punto de referencia para un público heterogéneo, nada elitista, que busca un teatro comprometido y de su época.
  4. Albergamos festivales de danza y teatro, tanto propios como externos, que enriquecen la programación de cada temporada.
  5. El espectador disfruta en nuestra sala del privilegio de la proximidad con el escenario y de la versatilidad del espacio.
  6. Nuestra línea de programación busca montajes renovadores y arriesgados porque nos gusta ser un espacio abierto al cambio.
  7. Además de la programación externa exhibimos la producción propia, con nuestra Compañía Cuarta Pared dirigida por Javier Yagüe y la compañía residente de danza, Provisional Danza, de Carmen Werner.
  8. Promovemos otras actividades, como encuentros con compañías, charlas, descuentos… en respuesta a la inquietud de nuestros espectadores.
  9. Ofrecemos ventajas extra a través del Club de Socios, porque si confías en Cuarta Pared, eres de Cuarta Pared.
  10. La respuesta del público nos avala. Unos 35.000 espectadores siguen nuestra programación cada temporada.

Difusión escénica

Reymala y Teatro la República unifican esfuerzos de logística y distribución a través de Difusión Escénica, que será la herramienta de comunicación, negociación y contratación de espectáculos de ambas compañías, además de otras producciones nacionales e internacionales.

Con esta unión se busca generar sinergias en una industria, la cultural, que no está pasando por su mejor momento, y que necesita reinventarse para seguir viva.

Equipo actoral

Yanara Moreno


Graduada en Dirección Teatral en la Escuela Nacional de Instructores de Teatro de Cuba. Como actriz comenzó desde los siete años en la TVCubana y con nueve,

en teatro profesional con la Compañía Teatro Estudio, Cuba. 

Cuenta con un amplísimo currículum como actriz de teatro, cine y televisión en su país natal, interpretando grandes obras del teatro universal. 

Ya en Canarias, ha participado en producciones tan importantes como “Tres”, “Las Criadas” “Abre el ojo”, “Don Juan Tenorio”, “Casa de muñecas”, “Boeing-Boeing”, “A vuestro gusto”, “Overbukin”, “La zapatera prodigiosa”, “Bodas de sangre” o “De vuelta al baile” y con Cías como: La República, Profetas de Mueble Bar,  Clapso. Prod. DD&company, 2RC Prod...etc.

En cine, en producciones como “Hello Hemingway” Dir: Fernando Pérez o “La Isla Interior” de Felix Sabroso y Dunia Ayaso.

En televisión ha participado como actriz en bcadenas  como Antena3 Canarias o TV Canaria.

Vincula su trabajo como actriz a la docencia, ejerciendo desde el año 2004 como profesora de teatro en La EMM “Candidito” en La Villa de Teror.

Miguel Ángel Maciel


Se inicia en el teatro en el año 1976 formándose con maestro de la talla de Felisa Yenny, Lito Cruz, Augusto Fernández.

Inicialmente se integra a grupos de teatro independiente hasta llegar a formar parte de las compañías más importantes de Buenos Aires, en teatros como, el Teatro General San Martín o el Teatro Nacional Cervantes.

Ha trabajado con destacados directores de la escena argentina como Santiago Doria, Rubén Schumager, Carlos Alvarenga, Hector Tealdi, Alejandra Boero, entre otros.

En permanente formación ha realizado talleres con directores como Will Keen o Eva Lesmes.

Actualmente desarrolla su actividad como actor y creador en la  Compañía  La República.

En otro orden de cosas ha sido Secretario de Organización de la Unión de Actores de Canarias hasta marzo del 2012.

Entre sus trabajos en España podemos destacar :

“Ciudadano Yago” (Nacho Cabrera)Versión de “Otelo” de Shakespeare. Cía La República  “Las Criadas” (Jean Genet) Ganadora Premio Réplica 2013 Mejor Espectáculo y Mejor Vestuario por Profetas de Mueble Bar “Hamelin” ( Juan Mayorga)  Cia La República

Toni Báez

Comienza sus estudios teatrales a mediados de los noventa en la Escuela de Actores de Canarias, a la vez que asiste a diferentes seminarios de interpretación impartidos por el maestro Jorge Eines. Años más tarde y después de haber colaborado con diferentes compañías teatrales de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, decide trasladarse a Madrid donde se titula en arte dramático por la escuela de interpretación Jorge Eines. Cabe destacar sus trabajos a las órdenes de Mario Gas en el Matadero de Madrid con el montaje “Ascensión y caída de la ciudad de Mahagonny” y “Belgrado” en el Teatro Español a las órdenes de Carlos Bolívar. Con Tábatha Producciones en el Palacio de Congresos de Murcia, “A golpes de Tango”;  “Agamenón. Volví del supermercado y le di una paliza a mi hijo” de Rodrigo García dirigida e interpretada por él mismo y más recientemente su participación en “El crimen de la perra Chona”.  

Daniel Tapia Alberto

Actor licenciado en la Escuela de actores de Canarias, empezó a formarse a los 16 años adquiriendo una férrea base en pantomima y esgrima. Amplió sus conocimientos en materias como didáctica teatral, espacio escénico , producción, gestión y distribución de espectáculos teatrales, Esgrima Mediaval, Narración Oral , Melodrama, y demás disciplina de la mano de Robert Muro, Fernando Bercebal, Philippe Gaulier, Patrick Pezzin, Thierry Taboni, Victoria Blasco, Benjamín Alonso, José Luis Raymond, Adolfo Vargas, Jep Meléndez, Renato Gato, Stefano Perocco y otros profesionales de renombre. Amplia sus estudios en Italia bajo la tutela de Adriano Iurssevich.

Como actor ha trabajado en diversos montajes, llegando a formar parte en compañías como , Cabaretutumba, Abubukaka, REYMALA, Artifest, Troysteatro. Con sus producciones Ha trabajado en EEUU, ITALIA, PERÚ y diversos festivales como Almagro, Fira Tárrega, Almería, Burgos, Almeria, Alcalá de Henares, entre otros.

Actualmente trabaja de Actor y Productor de la compañía REYMALA, como Distribuidor de “Difusión Escénica”

Sara Álvarez Hernández

 En Cádiz pasa a recibir formación en EmeTeatro, escuela de Germán Corona, director del Centro Dramático Nacional con el montaje “Cementerio de automóviles”, de Fernando Arrabal. Pasando luego a su compañía y haciendo gira por parte de Andalucía y Madrid, durante 5 años.

Termina obteniendo la titulación Superior de Interpretación escénica por la escuela de Actores de Canarias en la promoción 2009-2013, o la número 13.

Ha trabajado como figurante y acróbata, tanto para la compañía alemana Titanick con su espectáculo “Firebirds”, como para La Fura dels Baus, con “Afrodita o el juicio de Paris”.

Ha trabajado como actriz en HelenaTurbo Teatro, en un homenaje a Pérez Galdós,en el musical “Pippi”, de Jabiiniciativas,  con Espectáculos del Plata, en el infantil “El país de las moscas”, y en el recién estrenado espectáculo para bebés “Ahora”, con los montajes para bares “Las Rameras errantes” en verso, “El Superfollón”, “Familia, dulce familia”, y el también recién estrenado “Inseguridad social”, bajo la dirección de Jorge Reyes, con Teatro la República en una lectura dramatizada a nivel nacional, con la obra “El año que se rompió mi corazón”, bajo la dirección de Nacho Cabrera.

Como mérito, mencionar su premio a mejor actriz revelación en el festival de teatro clásico de Moratalaz con el montaje “La comedia de los asnos”, bajo la dirección de German Corona.

Textos: QY Bazo


QY Bazo somos Enrique y Yeray Bazo.  Hemos sido galardonados con el XIV Premio de Teatro Mínimo Rafael Guerrero por la obra Modelo 17 05 y con el Premio de Textos Teatrales Jesús Domínguez, por la obra Tesla/Edison. Hemos escrito y estrenado:

Adaptaciones: El dardo en la palabra (2010) de Lázaro Carreter y ¿A quién le importa? (2013) de Jorge Berlanga. 

Infantiles: la versión de Brundibár (2008) de Hans Krása y ¿Qué sabes del timple? (2012), espectáculo nominado a Mejor Espectáculo Infantil en los Premios Réplica de Teatro de Canarias.

Obras colectivas: Voces fuera de lugar (2011); Mujeres de papel (2013), donde trabajamos el Orlando de Virginia Wolf; Archipiélago Dron (2013) y Pastel de Lagrange (2013), en la que colaboramos con Juan Mayorga.

Formatos breves: Modelo 17 05 (2013); Entre líneas (2013), texto seleccionado en el Primer Certamen de Monólogos del Teatro Cuyás; Paraíso temporal (2013), estrenada en OCUPA Madrid; Interferencias (2013) y El hombre del chaleco verde (2014), que forma parte del documental Mapa de recuerdos de Madrid.

Somos colaboradores habituales del Nuevo Teatro Fronterizo de José Sanchis Sinisterra y hemos sido becados por la Sala Cuarta Pared en el EN BLANCO 2012, donde escribimos Última transmisión, y nos invitaron a participar en el EN BLANCO 2.O, donde escribimos Los Impostores. 


Nacho Cabrera (Dirección escénica)

Licenciado Superior en Arte Dramático, consolidando estudios entre la RESAD y la EAC, así como cursos abiertos en la William Layton, etc.. Completa estudios con Stephan Suschke Co-Director del Berliner Ensemble. Perfecciona estudios de investigación en la ULPGC, con el trabajo “La creación colectiva Europa vs América”.

Una amplia experiencia en dirección le avala desde 1998 en distintos campos. Destacamos en el campo de la lírica “El empresario de las Canarias”, de G.B. Martíni/P., “Diario de un desaprecido”, de Leos Janácek, “Rita” y “El elixir de amor” deGaetano Donizetti, “Los Cuentos de Hoffmann” de Offenbach, etc.. así como numerosas zarzuelas, entre las que destacamos “Bohemios” de texto original de Perrín y Palacios y música de Amadeo Vives, “Agua, Azucarillos y Aguardiente” de F. Chueca, etc..

Distintos espectáculos de música clásica, conciertos y espectáculos entre los que se destaca “Beethoven, Canciones Populares Europeas“, .”En clave de Sol“, “ABBA Mia“, “Superconstellation“, “Platero”, etc… También espectáculos musicales para televisión “Gofiones. 40 años navegando“, “Homenaje a Perico Lino“, “La transtienda“, Galas de Carnaval, etc..

Así mismo ha dirigido numerosas puestas en escena para oratorios, coro y orquestas.

En el campo de la escena teatral ha dirigido diversas compañías y productoras entre las que destacamos La Repúbica, Producciones del Mar, Difusión Escénica, Reymala, Caravan LAB, Mocan Teatro, Merde per tutti, La bella compañía, Teatro sospechoso...

En el ámbito del teatro su trabajo va desde la comedia al drama, destacando entre sus puestas “Ciudadano Yago” Versión de Otelo de Shakespeare,  (actualmente en cartel), “Hamelin” de Juan Mayorga, “Cuando las mujeres asaltaron los cielos” versión de Macbeth de Shakespeare, “NWC – No War Cabaret” de Nacho Cabrera, “Dedos” de Borja Ortiz de Gondra, “Nano” deSuso del Toro, etc….


En paralelo también ha desarrollado su carrera como actor en teatro con montajes como “Poemas de Pedro Lezcano”, “Poemas y cartas a Lorca“, “Fábula del Insomino“, “La mosca detrás de la oreja“, “La farinera“. “De un modo Sentimental”, “El oso”, “Sueño de barrio”, “Chatarra”, etc…

En series de televisión como “El juramento de Puntabrava” … y presentado programas de tv. como “Farándula” y “Caminando Gran Canaria”

Su experiencia también le avala como dramaturgista y guionista donde podemos destacar “Chatarra”, “NWC – No War  Cabaret”, “Y ellos me enseñaron el teatro”, “Olé Torero”, etc… y textos publicados como “Kursk”, “Cuando las mujeres asaltaron los cielos”. 

En otro orden de cosas, es miembro oficial de Junta Directiva de la ADE (Asociación de Directores de Escena de España), miembro fundador de APTC (Asociación de Productoras de Teatro de Canarias)

En el área docente, es profesor del CSMC (Conservatorio Superior de Música de Canarias) desde el año 2003, donde ha sido Jefe de Estudios y de Departamento del mismo. Ha dirigido diversas aulas de teatro en numerosos centros de Bachillerato y colegios. Director de la Escuela de Teatro Muncipal de Ingenio y de Agüimes. Director del TET (Teatro Escuela de Temisas).

Su trabajo ha podido verse en Canarias, Sevilla, Portugal, Valencia, Zaragoza, Navarra, La Coruña, Valladolid, Gijón, Las Palmas, Cáceres, Madrid, Jaén, Compostela, Salamanca, etc… y en países como Chile, Colombia, Perú, Marruecos, Reino Unido (Manchester), etc…

Sinopsis

“Los impostores” es la una historia sobre la pavorosa cotidianidad, aquella que hace que nos hace mentir y esconder los despojos de nuestro y otras vidas, según el frecuente y acostumbrado devenir de cada familia de bien.

Este ha sido históricamente un país de sepultureros, donde la mejor solución a las cosas es sentir el terraguero de silencio que cae sobre el ataúd de la verdad. Este país es una colectividad donde preferimos inhumar a exhumar, y donde anteponemos el encantamiento y el hechizo de los camposantos silenciosos y mágicos. Somos un país donde preferimos compartir nuestras vidas con los efluvios del alma, que con los destellos de la verdad…

 “Los impostores” es un campo de batalla que desde la unidad de guerra más pequeña, la familia, nos deja al descubierto la carnaza de la que estamos hechos los hombres, a pesar de la querencia que decimos manifestar por el prójimo más cercano. 

Los charlatanes y mentirosos tienen su cobertura más segura en el ámbito de la familia, como también sucede en las grandes corporaciones y lobbies que gobiernan este país.

Nuestros impostores son visitados por una particular de voz de la conciencia, en forma de “abuelo ausente”, que lo único que viene a hacer finalmente, es subrayar un texto que además habla del desasosiego…. “no hay solución”.

Y al final nos asaltan las dudas. ¿Después de tantas mentiras continuadas, seríamos capaces de distinguirla de la verdad en nuestra memoria? ¿Y si quisiéramos abrirnos en canal a la verdad, podríamos recuperar todo lo oscurecido por nuestros propios recuerdos?. 

Hemos aceptado la amnesia como pacto, desde el cotidiano espectador, hasta la prensa de este país pasando por la justicia que nos protege. El oxímoron del “instante eterno”.

Para transportarlo todo a escena, proponemos el viejo sistema de colocarnos en el lugar del otro, en el lugar de lo “mas verdadero” y que no es otra posición que la del “abuelo ausente”… Justamente este es el personaje, que proponemos sacar del armario para observar el resto vida que se recluye en una gran vitrina a modo de armario o tumba, como expositor de nuestras propias vidas. Aunque a lo mejor, y de manera más precisa, quizás deberíamos decir que pretendemos arrastrar al público al interior del armario del “abuelo ausente”. 

¿Y si nos situamos en otra cara del poliedro planteado por los autores?. ¿Y si este personaje, fueran el plano de lo real, y desde esa realidad fuéramos capaces de ver la partida de que los que están en otro plano están jugando? ¿Y si damos el valor preciso a las reflexiones de los autores asumiendo eso de que “juego entre dos o más personas mediante el que se engañan a sí mismas, un juego que es el juego del autoengaño mutuo”.?

Destino de los fondos

Los fondos serán destinados a finalizar de la construcción de la escenografía.

Notas finales

Llevamos meses de trabajo intenso para tener a punto esta producción en Noviembre. Estamos deseando que participes para que vivas con nosotros la experiencia de ser mecenas, productor, amigo y confidente.
¡Conviértete en impostor!
