story:
"I am Death... not quite what you expected, huh?"

How THE DEATH MONOLOGUES were born

I am Giselle Suarez. In 1995, my Cuban-American heart led me to the Netherlands, where a lifelong dream of acting and performing came true. I graduated from the Theater Academy in Utrecht and spent over a decade playing, directing and teaching in the European professional theater circuit.     In 2009, my heart led me back home, to be with my mother who had been diagnosed with a brain tumor. For nine months, I assisted her on her death journey, an experience that changed my life drastically. This challenging time transformed me and I was able to receive one of the greatest gifts in my life, the 'miracle' of death.

"I am your destiny and you can trust me. Although it's not a requirement and it won't do you any good in the end, but it might, just maybe, bring you some peace of mind."

My goal is to help shift how we view and experience death and dying in our culture. This inspired me to create THE DEATH MONOLOGUES, which unites my two arbitrary passions, theater and death. Death permeates the life of every single human being and yet is rarely approached, and even more rarely, approached in this way!

The DEATH MONOLOGUES is a unique theatrical experience that dives right into life's greatest taboo, death and dying. In this play, Death appears as our Master of Ceremonies. He is tired of getting a bad rap and has come to set the record straight. You will be taken on a ride showing five unique characters' perspectives that will shed a very different light on this subject.

“I do not like to fight. I always win, in the end, or in the middle or from the very start, I always win. It is no fun. I do not like to fight. I love to dance.”  ~Death~

As the author and performer of THE DEATH MONOLOGUES, I am very fortunate to have  Cathy Hartenstein as the director. Cathy holds an M.F.A in Directing from the University of Texas and has directed and worked in theaters all across the nation. She served as Education Director at the Cleveland Play House and has taught at several Universities. After just going through her father's death, we came together at the perfect time to collaborate on this special project.

We then received the exciting news that THE DEATH MONOLOGUES have been chosen for the 18th annual 2014 New York City International Theater Festival, the largest theater festival in North America! This is a a huge honor and a wonderful opportunity!

Our goal with THE DEATH MONOLOGUES is to take it out into the world and share its profound message. We want to provide a platform andl open up the conversation about this taboo topic by bringing it to places such as theaters, hospice homes, cancer centers, hospitals, schools and prisons. The exposure and momentum that performing THE DEATH MONOLOGUES at the New York Fringe Festival can bring to this project is invaluable! It is the perfect setting to share this unique and powerful message with a large, diverse audience and open up the conversation to help free us from the suffering that is caused by our misunderstanding and denial of death.

With your support, you are making a dream come true and helping us get this powerful, meaningful show from the small town of Cottonwood, Arizona to the big stage of New York, New York and beyond!


What We Need & What You Get

Your generous donations will go towards:

  • travel costs for actress and crew to get from Arizona to New York
  • Lodging for 2 weeks in New York
  • sustenance
  • production costs 
  • Fringe Festival required fees and costs
  • marketing and publicity costs

Every little bit helps! All the funds that exceed our goal will go towards THE DEATH MONOLOGUE tour, which will follow the NYC Fringe Festival. It all goes to help birth THE DEATH MONOLOGUES unto the stages of the world!

And we have some exciting perks to show our appreciation for your support!


The Impact

After my mother's death, I became involved with this subject in different ways, such as hospice work, giving workshops and lectures on dying consciously, end of life and grief counseling, becoming a Death Doula (a professional who helps and supports others at the end of life), and of course, the creation of THE DEATH MONOLOGUES.

Your donations to this project will not only be supporting the birth of this exciting, theatrical one woman show, but you will also be making a significant impact on helping to change how we view and experience death and dying in our culture.

The experience of THE DEATH MONOLOGUES will allow us to embrace our lives more fully and free us from our fears around death and dying. “So many people struggle with the concept of death in their lives”, says director Cathy Hartenstein. "We wanted to create a platform where people could look at it in a new light, talk about it, and hopefully experience it in a different way.”


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word! Tell your friends or anyone you think might be interested in this exciting, cutting edge project. We would greatly appreciate if you would share this campaign on your social media and anywhere else that would be appropriate. Thank you for making this possible! We can't wait to share it with you.

You can check out our website here:
http://www.deathmonologues.com

Like us on Facbook here:

http://www.facebook.com/thedeathmonologues

Follow us on Twitter here:                                                                                https://twitter.com/deathmonologues

Thank you!
story_txt:
"I am
Death... not quite what you expected, huh?"How THE DEATH MONOLOGUES were born

I am Giselle Suarez. In 1995, my Cuban-American heart led
me to the Netherlands, where a lifelong dream of acting and
performing came true. I graduated from the Theater Academy in Utrecht
and spent over a decade playing, directing and teaching in the
European professional theater circuit.     In 2009, my
heart led me back home, to be with my mother who had been diagnosed
with a brain tumor. For nine months, I assisted her on her death
journey, an experience that changed my life drastically. This
challenging time transformed me and I was able to receive one of the
greatest gifts in my life, the 'miracle' of death."I am your destiny and you can trust me. Although it's not a requirement and it won't do you any good in the end, but it might, just maybe, bring you some peace of mind."My goal is to help shift how we view and experience death and
dying in our culture. This inspired me to create THE DEATH
MONOLOGUES, which unites my two arbitrary passions, theater and
death. Death permeates the life of every single human being and yet is
rarely approached, and even more rarely, approached in this way! 
The DEATH MONOLOGUES is a unique theatrical experience that
dives right into life's greatest taboo, death and dying. In this
play, Death appears as our Master of Ceremonies. He is tired of
getting a bad rap and has come to set the record straight. You will
be taken on a ride showing five unique characters' perspectives that
will shed a very different light on this subject.“I do not like to fight. I always win, in the end, or in the
middle or from the very start, I always win. It is no fun. I do not
like to fight. I love to dance.”  ~Death~As the author and performer of THE DEATH MONOLOGUES, I am very
fortunate to have  Cathy Hartenstein as the director. Cathy
holds an M.F.A in Directing from the University of Texas and has
directed and worked in theaters all across the nation. She served as
Education Director at the Cleveland Play House and has taught at
several Universities. After just going through her father's death, we
came together at the perfect time to collaborate on this special
project.
We then received the exciting news that THE DEATH MONOLOGUES have
been chosen for the 18th annual 2014 New York City International
Theater Festival, the largest theater festival in North America!
This is a a huge honor and a wonderful opportunity! 

Our goal with THE DEATH MONOLOGUES is to take it out into the
world and share its profound message. We want to provide a platform
andl open up the conversation about this taboo topic by bringing it
to places such as theaters, hospice homes, cancer centers, hospitals,
schools and prisons. The exposure and momentum that performing THE
DEATH MONOLOGUES at the New York Fringe Festival can bring to this
project is invaluable! It is the perfect setting to share this unique
and powerful message with a large, diverse audience and open up the
conversation to help free us from the suffering that is caused by our
misunderstanding and denial of death. 

With your support, you are making a dream come true and helping us
get this powerful, meaningful show from the small town of Cottonwood,
Arizona to the big stage of New York, New York and beyond!
 What We Need & What You Get
Your generous donations will go towards:
travel costs for actress and crew to get from Arizona to New York

Lodging for 2 weeks in New York
sustenance
production costs 
Fringe Festival required fees and costs

marketing and publicity costs
Every little bit helps! All the funds that exceed our goal will go towards THE DEATH MONOLOGUE tour, which will follow the NYC Fringe Festival. It all goes to help birth THE DEATH MONOLOGUES unto the stages of the world!And we have some exciting perks to show our appreciation for your support!The Impact

After my mother's death, I
became involved with this subject in different ways, such as hospice
work, giving workshops and lectures on dying consciously, end of life
and grief counseling, becoming a Death Doula (a professional
who helps and supports others at the end of life), and of course, the
creation of THE DEATH MONOLOGUES. 
Your donations to this project will not only be supporting the
birth of this exciting, theatrical one woman show, but you will also be
making a significant impact on helping to change how we view and
experience death and dying in our culture.
The experience of THE DEATH MONOLOGUES will allow us to embrace
our lives more fully and free us from our fears around death and
dying. “So many people struggle with the concept of death in their
lives”, says director Cathy Hartenstein. "We wanted to create
a platform where people could look at it in a new light, talk about
it, and hopefully experience it in a different way.”Other Ways You Can HelpPlease help us spread the word! Tell your friends or anyone you think might be interested in this exciting, cutting edge project. We would greatly appreciate if you would share this campaign on your social media and anywhere else that would be appropriate. Thank you for making this possible! We can't wait to share it with you.You can check out our website here:http://www.deathmonologues.comLike us on Facbook here:
http://www.facebook.com/thedeathmonologues
Follow us on Twitter here:                                                                                https://twitter.com/deathmonologuesThank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hi - I'm Tim Crowther and this will be my first professional outing as both playwright and director. I have also taken on board a share of the production responsibilities - what can I say, I didn't feel like I'd taken enough on. And so - here I am, addressing you from within this crowdfunding site, asking for your support.

The piece I have written explores masculinity and (as mentioned previously), it aims to challenge our understanding of what it is to be 'manly'. Specifically, 'tis unmanly grief  looks at how men cope (or indeed) struggle to cope with grief, as a result of this absence of communication. CALM, (The Campaign Against Living Miserably) is "an award winning charity dedicated to preventing male suicide, the single biggest killer of men under the age of 45 in the UK". One reason for this (they have found), is that men struggle to be emotionally open. In fact, in the male community, there is still very much a stigma attached to this very idea of sensitivity and openness. 

It feels absolutely the right time for this project, as the themes addressed within the play are both current and hugely relevant to a twenty first century audience. You need only look as far as recent TV documentaries such as Professor Green: Suicide and Me; Rio Ferdinand: Being Mum and Dad and Diana, Our Mother, to see the importance of openness and the desperate need to address how men communicate - both in friendships and with family and loved ones.

It goes without saying that Theatre is the perfect platform to explore such a topic. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

With three weeks to go until opening night, and rehearsals just round the corner, for this production to be a reality, we very much need your help. 

It is essential that Theatre pays each and everyone of its creatives - in every aspect of a production. It is for this very reason that Theatre N16 signed an agreement with equity to be a registered equity fringe theatre venue, to make sure that actors walk away from a job, with a respectable, equity recognised, fee. 

But for this to be possible, and to ensure we deliver a high quality production, where elements such as lighting, sound and stage design are not sacrificed, we need to raise £2,000. The money raised--added to any private investment received--will go towards:

- Actors' fees.

- Publicity (this is vital if we are to reach as wide an audience as possible). 

- A theatre technician's fee

- Insurance to cover the audience and actors

- Costume, set and props

- Script printing

- Music rights

As director of the play (as well as writer and co-producer), I can honestly say that by supporting this campaign and donating, not only do you ensure that minimal sacrifices are being made when putting together the piece, but with every contribution you make (big or small), each time you alleviate a little bit of the financial burden and in effect, you become a 'backer' for the play - and to have backing (approving nods) would mean the world!

The Impact

I have already made contact with the charity CALM, and they have said (and have provided marketing material with regards to this) that the play (and its content) fully supports the work of the charity. They have also expressed an interest in assisting us to reach their target audience – people who they feel are most susceptible and/ or directly affected by the issues raised – Men under the age of 45 and close family and friends who may have also been affected. There are plans for a Q&A one evening where CALM will be on the panel, and their literature will be available each night at the theatre. With your support, all this and much more can be possible through the medium of Theatre. 

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges of this project are the same as anyone's first fringe outing - will it be good and will it get an audience? I'm confident it will be good - the script has gone through numerous edits, workshops and readings, and I have now secured an exciting artist/ stage designer, Deborah Bowness (https://www.deborahbowness.com), as well as what I believe to be a sterling cast: Natasha Pring, Damien Hasson and Aaron Anthony.  

Between myself, Jamie Eastlake of Eastlake Productions and Theatre N16 (as well as the other actors and Stage Designer), I think we have a pretty wide reach in terms of audience... and we continue to shamelessly plug away. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any donation, of any size, is massively appreciated - special thank you's and mentions is a given, so watch out on social media. However if you can't help out financially that's fine! We are equally grateful for anyone who can give us a hand by tweeting the play, following the play on Facebook, telling their friends and family, and generally helping me get the word out.

And of course there is no greater way to show your support for the project, than coming along to see the play - hope to see you there!

https://www.theatren16.co.uk/unmanlygrief

story:
The Idea

Actors in the Master Classes at the Barrow Group who conceived this presentation see an opportunity to support the company by doing this play as a benefit. They are working on 11 separate scenes that illustrate the  disparate pieces of Mary Page Marlowe's life. The play by Tracy Letts is structured as an elaborate mosaic showing snippets of Mary Page in her life as a vital young woman, as a child, as an older woman at the end of her life, as a a middle aged mom. The play seems to us an invitation, perfect for working the scenes separately with several  directors, and then stitching the pieces together at the end of the rehearsal process. We are all very excited to be involved. 

When

May 31 and June 1 at 8:00pm

Where

The Barrow Group

Studio 3 A 

312 West 36th Street 3rd Floor

New York, New York

Who

Written by Tracy Letts

Directed by Cailin Kless, Blaire O'Leary, Ron Piretti and Stephen Singer

Featuring Lilith Bachelder, Tressa Brooks, Alison Chace*, Jeffery Cusumano, Gabriel De Leon, Christine Donnelly*, Lucie Fleming, Lesley Noyes, Blaire O'Leary*, Greg Seel*,J.P. Stewart*, Victor Verhaeghe*, Michal Vondel, and Ilise Weiner.

Stage Managed by Andrew Dobbie

Executive Producer - Blaire O'Leary

Associate Producer - Christine Donnelly

* Actors Appear Courtesy of Actors Equity Association

Equity Approved Benefit

Our Story

Barrow Group Master Classes are comprised of an ever changing group of professional actors moving through New York's acting world, performing in TV, theater and film. Although we regularly present bits of theater from all kinds of different sources in our sessions at the Barrow Group, this project offered us a chance to work on a single piece of artistic expression.

Why We Need You to Donate to the Barrow Group

Donating to our show helps us defray our expenses and will allow us to support our artistic home.

We need $500 for production costs including the play rights, and a professional stage manager. The remainder of the donations will be added to the Barrow Group Spring Fundraiser which supports Barrow Group productions and Barrow Group school scholarships. Our goal is to raise $1,500, in order to give $1,000 to the Barrow Group to express our solidarity.

Every dime is deeply felt, and goes directly  defraying our costs and to supporting the mission of the Barrow Group. If everyone on our mailing lists donated just $20, we would reach our goal. We ask you now to please consider making a small (or large!) donation toward this highly charged project to support the Barrow Group.
